Her plan for the future is to expand her store more, adding new products to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, and bottles

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Miguel  está soltero, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación diversificada, esta graduado de una carrera, se dedica al tejido de cortes y sabanas, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su papa, y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima, para aumentar su producción de tejidos, va a comprar materia prima consistente en hilos de diferentes colores, espera tener en el futuro un negocio posicionado y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is single. He is 22 years old. He completed upper secondary school and graduated from a program. He weaves clothing and sheets. He started this business with the support of his father, and he has 3 years of experience up to now.

He is asking for a loan that he will use to buy raw material in order to increase his production of textiles. He is going to buy raw material consisting of thread in different colors. In the future he hopes to have an established business with better earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread for textiles

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, se encuentra en el 6º ciclo con 20 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar. Se dedican a variadas actividades, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras para salir adelante.
La Sra. Ramona cuenta que con esfuerzo trabaja como empleada doméstica y también se dedica a la venta de comestibles con la intención de tener mayores ingresos, nos dice que trabajando es la única forma que una persona tiene para salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Está muy contenta por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas is from the city of Carapeguá. It is in its sixth cycle and has twenty members who are all hard-working women who do their best to make progress. They work in different businesses, but they also help each other get ahead.

Ramona says she works with effort as a domestic, and she also works selling food products so that she can have more income. She tells us that work is the only way a person can move forward in life and be someone.

She is requesting the loan to purchase meat, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients so that she can keep making the food she sells. She is very happy with the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Dianey Trixi

texts.es: La Sra. Emma de 39 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 2 dependientes económicos. Ella sabe que tiene que salir adelante por sus dos hijos, siempre se ha esforzado por ofrecerles lo mejor es por eso que tiene dos trabajos uno es desempeñándose como secretaria en la oficina de correo en el turno de día y el otro es un negocio que tiene ubicado en su domicilio de esta manera ella se encarga de que sus hijos no tengan carencia alguna. En esta ocasión Emma está solicitando un crédito para remodelación de un cuarto en su casa. Agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Emma is 39 years old and is divorced with two dependent children. She knows that she needs to keep working hard for her two children, and she has always strived to provide them with the best. To do so she works two jobs: she works as a secretary at the post office during the day and she runs a business out of her home by night. This way she ensures that her children do not lack for anything. Emma is requesting a loan at this time in order to remodel a room in her home. She is grateful for any assistance you may be able to provide.

loans.use: to remodel a room in her house.

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modeste  est le membre et le président du groupe Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui aiment à cultiver».Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 ans  à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Modeste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son Quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.

REMARQUE:Le crédit antérieur était la troisième cycle pas la premier cycle c'est une erreur à corriger.
texts.en:
Philippe is a member and the president of the group Dukundubuhinzi no. 3A/RSZ. The name of this group means "those who like farming". He is 40 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 6; one of them is at school. Philippe himself has six years of primary education.

Philippe is a rice farmer. This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB and he plans to use the credit to buy fertilizers and pay for labor. Philippe has stated that the previous loans have greatly helped his activity, and he has not experienced any difficulties with repayment. 

He plans to expand his business by obtaining additional loans to bolster his activities. In the coming years, Philippe hopes to become the leading rice farmer in the region. He plans to use his profits to provide for his children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Nyameke

texts.en: Nyameke  is married and has three children. She sells plantains at Jukwa near Abura. Nyameke has been selling food for the past eight years. She uses her income to help her husband pay their housing costs. Nyameke will use her loan to purchase more varieties of food stuffs to sell. With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She sells new clothes in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also earns additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more clothes, jewelry, and shoes to sell. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and start importing new clothes form China and Dubai. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes, jewelry and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and a married mother of one child. She lives with her family in Msambweni, a town in the coastal region of Kenya which is well known for its nice beaches that attract many tourists.
Mariam makes her living in selling makuti (thatching materials made from palm frond). She has been in this business for the last eight years.Mariam buys makuti from various places. She also buys fronds and makes makuti to sell. She is requesting the loan to purchase more makuti to take advantage of this rainy season that requires most people to repair their leaking roofs.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (thatching material).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es: La Sra. Lucero está solicitando el crédito para comprar mercancía, ella está casada el cual se dedica a dar mantenimiento de refrigeración en fabricas de la localidad. Comenta la Sra. Lucero que vivian un poco limitados en gastos por los estudios de sus hijos, y ella decidió emprender un pequeño negocio en él  la cual se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva, perfumes, bolsas, accesorios etc. actualmente tiene 3 hijos pero solo uno es dependiente aun del  matrimonio.
texts.en: Lucero is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. She is married and her husband does cooling maintenance for the factories in the area. Lucero says that they were living a little limited in expenses for their children's studies, and she decided to start a small business in which she buys and sells new clothing, perfumes, bags, accesories, etc. She actually has three children, but only one of them is still dependent on the couple.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Vilman Elisabeth

texts.es:
La señora Vilman Elisabeth es casada, tiene 46 años de edad, estudio hasta el nivel diversificado, tiene 4 hijos 2 los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio siendo vendedor ambulante y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien dedica al mismo oficio. 

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de mercadería consistente en ropa: playeras, lencería, calzado para bebés, sudaderos. En el futuro espera ver su negocio más grande con la inversión que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Vilman Elisabeth is married, she is 46 years old, and has a high school education. She has four children, two of them in school. She works as a merchant, selling clothing. She started this business as a street vendor and has six years of experience so far. She gets help from her husband, who works in the same trade.

She has decided to request a loan and will use it to purchase merchandise: clothing items like t-shirts, lingerie, baby shoes, and sweatshirts.  By making this investment she hopes to see her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other products

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
La  Señora Marta tiene 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Tocoa, Departamento de Colon en compañía de su hijo y esposo.
Desde hace 5 años comenzó su negocio de venta de alimentos de la canasta básica a través de una pulpería o tienda de consumo. En su negocio vende arroz, manteca, azúcar café, papel higiénico, carnes, helados, medicamentos para enfermedades comunes, alimentos enlatados y golosinas.
Marta  ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras para surtir más su pulpería y hacer inversión en el mejoramiento de la apariencia de su negocio (mejoramiento de paredes y piso).
Considera que teniendo una buena administración de su negocio, logrará que su clientela siga creciendo al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta, 27, lives in the town of Tocoa, Colon Department with her son and husband.  She started selling basic staples five years ago in a grocery store.  She sells rice, lard, sugar coffee, toilet paper, meats, ice-cream, medicine for common illnesses, canned goods and sweets.  

Marta has requested a 12,000 Lempira loan to better stock her grocery store and to invest in improving its appearance (improve walls and floor).  She considers that if her store is managed well her clientele as well as her profits will continue growing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to improve the store's appearance.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Mercedes de la ciudad de Luque surgio por medio de una de las miembros, quien con ganas de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas las motivo a que dia a dia se esfuerzen al maximo para salir adelante.
La sra.Julia , una de las miembros, se dedica a la costura, esta casada con el señor Victor. Ella solicito el credito para la compra de tela, hilos y todos los demas insumos necesarios para la costura, ella trabaja en su casa en conjunto con su mama, trabajan para una fabrica, pero en su domicilio, ella espera algun dia tener un negocio mas grande y mas personal para una mejor produccion.
texts.en:
The group Las Mercedes in the city of Luque was started by one of its members, who wanted to help her friends and neighbors, and motivated them to do their utmost best in order to get ahead.  

One of these members, Julia, works sewing. She is married to Victor. She has requested the loan to purchase fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies. She works at home along with her mother. They both work for a factory but she hopes to one day have a larger and more personal business so that production improves.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives at Kakata with her husband and three children. She is 36 years old. Mamie stopped her education in the 6th grade. Her children are between the ages of 7 and 18 and are currently in school. 

Mamie has been involved in her business for the past 10 years. She sells palm oil, pepper, rice, cooking oil, salt, onions and other items in the market. She started with a little income that she received from her husband. Now she is proud because with the profit that she generates from the business, she buys goods to improve the business and helps her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, salt, onions and other items for the business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, salt, onions and other items for the business.

loans.name: Nixon Eder

texts.es:
Nixon es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, tiene 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Nixon puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de reparación y conversión de vehículos, en especial de gips, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana él asiste a su pequeño taller ubicado en un grifo de su ciudad, donde alquila un pequeño espacio para realizar sus labores, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que la bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Nixon se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas para su taller, tales como tuercas, llaves, gata, entre otros; de esta manera Nixon tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá contar con las herramientas necesarias para realizar su labor, así él espera aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su taller propio.
texts.en:
Nixon is a 28-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He has two children, whom he loves and who are the principal reason for his life. Unfortunately, for various reasons, he is separated from his partner.

Nixon is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to moving his family ahead. Thanks to his effort, he was able to study for a technical career as an automobile mechanic. In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and, on some occasions, he cooks a very delicious “Ceviche” to share with his family. 

With a great deal of hard work, enthusiasm and thanks to his mother’s support, Nixon started his small business repairing and converting vehicles, especially GPS systems. Every day from early hours of the morning, he goes to his small workshop located at a service station in the city, where he rents a small space to do his work. He can work approximately 12 hours a day and believes that he is doing well because of his dedication and the friendly service he gives his customers.

Nixon is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given him, he was able to purchase tools for his workshop, such as screws, wrenches and jacks, among others. Consequently, Nixon will have his business better equipped and will have the tools at hand that he needs to do his work. Thus, he plans to expand his services and increase his earnings, which will insure that in the not too distant future, he will be able to have his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Glenda Ziomara

texts.es:
La  Señora Glenda tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en el municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Con el fin de obtener ingresos que le permitan sostener su familia, Doña Glenda inicio su negocio desde hace 10 años, dicho negocio consiste en la venta de ropa, cosméticos y joyería (aretes y cadenas).
 Para tener más opciones que ofrecer a sus clientes, ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras para la compra de un fardo de ropa usada o de segunda mano.
Ella piensa que esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Glenda, 45, is a single mother.  She has two children and lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida Department.  Aiming at earning income to support her family, Glenda started her business ten years ago.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and jewelry (earrings and chains).

In order to have more options available for her customers, she’s requested a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy a bundle of second-hand or used clothes.  She believes that this investment will help her earn higher income so that she can provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: La Novia Del Norte Horqueta Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con 10 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad por mas pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, por la oportunidad de progreso que les está dando la fundación y Kiva.
Hilaria es la presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. El sueño de Hilaria es que su familia no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones y es por eso que lucha.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, etc.
texts.en: The committee has ten members each with her own activity no matter how small.  They are very excited because of the opportunity they are being given by the Fundación and Kiva.  Hilaria is the president and she sells basic staples to help her family and give them what they need to live with dignity and decorum.  Hilaria’s dream is that her family not goes through any sort of privation which is why she strives so hard.  She’s asking for the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, etc.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products and baked goods.

loans.name: Virgen De Itacua Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Itacuá es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2010.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas y es gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio que está saliendo adelante y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza para poder dejar atrás la pobreza.
Cuenta la Sra. María que el crédito que solicita de la fundación y kiva lo utilizará para la compra de insumos y bebidas para su negocio,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Virgen de Itacuá is from the city of Encarnación.  They're in the eighth cycle of the women entrepreneurs program and they've worked with the foundation since 2010.

One of the members of the group in María.  She makes a living selling food and beverages, and thanks to her work and sacrifice she's getting ahead.  This is why she always makes the effort to be able to leave poverty behind.

María says that she'll buy supplies and beverages for her business with the loan she's requesting from the foundation and Kiva.

She's very grateful because thanks to the loan she'll be able to improve her income and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and other supplies

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena cooks banku to sell at Jukwa near Abura. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetable sauce. Abena is marrried and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assists the husband in the general upkeep of their home. Abena will use her loan to purchase maize for her banku, fish and vegetables for her sauce. With the new profit, Abena wishes to mount a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: purchase maize for her banku, fish and vegetables for her sauce.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells saucepans at Jukwa near Abura. She has been into this business for 7 years now. She is married to a mason and has 2 children. Efua uses her income to assist the husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will need a loan to purchase saucepans and other cooking utensils for sale. With the new profit, Efua hope to build a shop where she will sell her cooking utensils.

loans.use: purchase saucepans and other cooking utensils for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian runs a boutique business in Kapsabet town, and has been in operation for two years now, earning 15,000 KES monthly. The business really improved greatly, so she has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD for 80,000 KES and plans to use it to purchase new clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will plough them back into business. Her hope and dream is that her business prospers so as to earn more profits and expand her boutique shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Lord Own Group

texts.en:
The Lord Own group is made up of 3 women who sell items such as fish, soap, and shoes. 

Caroline is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, single, and has a child.

Caroline sells shoes and soap to her customers and also delivers on demand. She started this business 7 years ago by using her own funds. Her main challenge is that she sometimes has to sell on credit.

With this new loan, she will be able to buy 2 boxes of shoes and 1 box of soap. She has been with ID Ghana for 3 years, and this is her fifth loan. She needs Kiva’s support of 1,200 Ghana Cedis. 

They need a total of 2,100 Ghana Cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of shoes and 1 box of soap

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 16 years. He will use his loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows him very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs in his maize production.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El Sr. Armando es de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene un taller de tornería y se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 20 años, está casado tiene 2 hijos, quienes son su razón de lucha.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias  tiene varias operaciones ya con la fundación,  además de eso nos cuenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo da a su familia todo lo que puede para que no pasen por necesidades.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materiales, como ser varillas de hierro, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus pedidos.
texts.en: Armando’s from the city of Pilar.  He has a lathe metal shop, an activity he’s been in for 20 years.  He’s married and has two children who are the reason he strives for.  He’s a very hardworking person with good references.  He’s has several transactions with the Fundación already and he also relates that thanks to his hard work he gives his family everything he can so that they will lack nothing.  He’s asking for the loan to invest in his business with the purchase of materials like iron rods to continue working and filling orders.

loans.use: to buy iron rods.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
El señor Basilides tiene 47 años, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Felipa y viven en su propia de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Basilides es dueño de un Comedor en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene mucha clientela en la zona ya que su local se encuentra situado cerca de la terminal por lo tanto acuden turistas y clientes de los alrededores. La esposa es cocinera y se dedica a organizar el menú y preparar las variadas comidas. Gracias a este trabajo ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier imprevisto.
El señor Basilides ha solicitado este crédito para la ampliación de la cocina del local, ya que es muy necesario para seguir trabajando y de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Basilides, 47, has been married to Felipa for a long time; they live in their own house in the city of Encarnación.  Basilides owns a snack bar in downtown Encarnación.  He has many customers in the area because his snack bar is located near a terminal so many tourists and customers from the area come by.  His wife’s the cook and organizes the menu and prepares a variety of dishes.  Thanks to this work they have been able to get ahead, educate their children, maintain their home and overcome unexpected expenses.  Basilides has asked for this loan to enlarge the snack bar’s kitchen because it’s necessary in order to continue working and to increase income.

loans.use: to enlarge the kitchen.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es de profesion albañil y cuenta que hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a su profesion. Comenta que está casado y que su señora lo ayuda cuidando la casa y con otros trabajos que ella hace.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta además que siempre tiene mucho trabajo ya que tiene una vasta experiencia en lo que está haciendo.  Solicitó el credito para arreglo de su vivienda, ya que quiere poder dar un techo digno a su familia, y sabe que este crédito le ayudará mucho.
texts.en: Carlos works in construction and has been working in his profession for more than 20 years.  He comments that he’s married and his wife helps him by caring for the house and with other work she does.  He’s a very hardworking person and he says that he always has much work because he has vast experience in his line of work.  He requested the loan to do some home repairs because he wants to provide a proper home for his family and he knows that this loan will help him very much to do so.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells mazie and gari at Jukwa near Abura. Maame has been selling gari and maize for 15 years now. She lives together with her husband and her 7 dependents. Her husband operates a grocery shop. Maame uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase bags of gari and maize for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of gari and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for 11 years now. Mary is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver and they live together at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income to support the husband to feed and clothe their children. Mary will use her loan to purchase hair extentions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her salon. With the new profit, Mary will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase hair extentions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Florence Group

texts.en:
This is Florence group. The group is made up of Florence and Gladys, who work in cosmetics and hairdressing. They are 54 and 32 years old, respectively.

Florence is a 54-year-old cosmetics seller. She has been doing this job for 25 years and is in her 4th loan cycle with ID Ghana. She was given 400 Ghana cedis in her 3rd loan cycle, which she used to buy more hair and body pomades, shea butter, and fragrance. Florence sells to customers in Nungua, a suburb of Accra. She saves part of her profit with ID Ghana and reinvests a portion. She is married and has 3 children.

Florence and Gladys together need 1,050 Ghana cedis to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more hair and body pomades, shea butter, and fragrance.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 42 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have five children who are enrolled in school. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs of maize production and buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With her profits from farming, Pelagie wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines such as tractors to enhance her farming capacity. This photo was taken recently at a maize farming plantation. Pelagie was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family's needs and her business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs of maize production.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a person who enjoys her work and is very responsible in her activities. She lives with her six children, only one of whom is still in school. She is a widow but does not give up on life. 

Sophia earns a living by selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years and this is the first loan she is requesting from Yehu. She will use her loan to buy sacks of charcoal to stock her store. This investment will allow Sophia to increase her sales, which will help her improve her children's quality of life. Sophia's dream is to expand her market so that she can distribute her charcoal to other places.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria desde pequeña quizo tener un negocio propio para lo cual consulto con sus familiares(padres)una base fuera de la casa para una bazar-fotocopiadora. 

En la actualidad tiene su bazar-fotocopiadora, su horario de trabajo empieza 7:30am hasta las 22:00pm y su hermana le ayuda en el negocio, unas de sus dificultades es que su salud decaiga y no pueda atender su negocio. 
Con el prestamo quiere comprar papeleria y cuadernos, tambien ayudar en un restaurante con el prestamo va a comprar papelerias, snack y colas
texts.en:
Maria, from the time she was small, wanted to own a business. Thus she consulted with her relatives (parents) about acquiring a space outside of the house to have a photocopy and stationary shop.

Currently she has a stationary and photocopy shop. Her work schedule begins at 7:30 a.m. until 10 p.m. and her sister helps her in the business. One of her difficulties is that her health has declined and she can no longer take care of her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase stationary and notebooks and also help in a restaurant. With the loan, she is going to buy stationary, snacks and colas.

loans.use: to purchase stationary, notebooks.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
14 de Agosto se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta la Sra. Zoila, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 3 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Zoila siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando por sus metas y así ser cada día mejores. Ella se dedica a la costura y nos dice que siempre está muy atareada con los trabajos que recibe, ya que tiene mucho y es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar telas e hilos, como también botones y cierres para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
14 de Agosto is the name of a good group of women which was founded in the city of Itá thanks to Zolia, the current President, who contacted the advisor at a weekly meeting she had in the area, to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Committee) worked. When she learned about the program, she managed to bring 21 women together. They support each other and are now working collectively on their third cycle within the program.

Zoila always tries to motivate her fellow members to keep fighting for their goals and better themselves. She is a seamstress and tells us that the jobs she receives always keep her very busy, because she gets a lot of them. That is why she is requesting a loan, because she wants to purchase fabric and thread as well as buttons and zippers so that she can fill all of the orders she has. She is thankful for the help she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca es casada, tiene tres hijos, y viven en la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella es una persona que siempre ha trabajado y por medio de ese trabajo ayuda a su marido con la manutención de la casa y de sus hijos.
Es dueña de una despensa bien surtida en su casa en donde se maneja con sus hijos, y comenta que su esposo es constructor de obras, de esta forma ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a la familia.
Francisca solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su despensa con los productos que mas salida tienen, como ser gaseosas, leche, panificados, verduras y productos de limpieza. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo de Kiva y fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Francisca’s married and has three children; they all live in the city of Encarnación.  She’s someone who has always worked and by means of her work helps her husband to support the home and their children.

She owns a well-stocked grocery store at home that she runs with her children.  She comments that her husband works in construction and this way they both strive to get ahead and help the family.

Francisca has requested the loan to stock her store with the items that sell the most like soft-drinks, milk, baked goods, vegetables and cleaning supplies.  She’s grateful for the help she’s getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, milk, baked goods, vegetables and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité “San Cayetano” de la ciudad de Ybycui trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya desde julio del 2010. Actualmente el comité está integrado por 10  señoras de la misma zona y se dedican a distintas actividades que les genera buenos ingresos. Las integrantes del comité son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, manifestaron que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente.
Mariela es la presidenta, y cuenta que vende todo tipo de comidas, y dice que tiene buena venta, ya que tiene unja clientela formada que siempre compra de ella sus productos, ya que son muy ricos. Su meta es algún día poder tener un gran restaurante y así deleitar a más personas con las exquisiteces que hace.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, panificados y demás.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” committee is from the city of Ybycui and has worked with Fundación Paraguaya since July, 2010.  It currently has 10 members who are from the same neighborhood and who carry out various activities that generate good income.  The members of the committee are very united, responsible and mutually supportive.  They stated that they very much want to work and to get ahead both as a group and individually.

Mariela is group president.  She relates that she sells all types of food and says that her sales are good because she has a well-established, regular clientele that always buys her products from her because they are very delicious.  Her goal is to someday open a great restaurant to delight more people with the exquisite dishes she prepares.  She requests the loan to buy vegetables, condiments, baked goods and others.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, baked goods and others.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Aty, se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con doce integrantes de la ciudad de Curuguaty.  Este comité ha demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes tiene cada una  actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras.
 Sebastiana es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con los artículos básicos que sus clientes puedan necesitar. Ella cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su sacrificio ha podido crecer e ir ganando experiencia. Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, frutas, lácteos y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty Communal Bank, which has 12 members from the city of Curuguaty, is in its second cycle.  This bank has shown unity and solidarity among its members, each one of whom has her own job and is very hardworking.

Sebastiana is one of the members of this group.  She has a well-supplied store with the basic items her customers might need.  She says she began with very little, but that thanks to her sacrifice she has been able to grow and gain experience.

She's requesting the loan to be able to supply her business with vegetables, fruit, dairy products, and other supplies with which she'll be able to continue giving her customers what they need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, dairy products, and other supplies

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar is a married man with 5 children in addition to a dependent who is his nephew. All the children attend school. Umar charges car, as well as phone, batteries and sells food stuffs, like groceries, to meet his family's needs. He wants 600,000 UGX to pay school fees for his son who is completing high school. His main challenge is high cost of electricity which eats into his income, reducing his profit. Umar works so hard to see all his children through school.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is the woman preparing fufu. She operates a chop bar where a variety of African dishes are sold. She has done this for 5 years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and 6 dependents. Alice uses her income to support the husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food items and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Alice plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: purchase food items and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Joweria operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She also earns additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. Joweria has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy more serving utensils, tables, rice, bunches of bananas, cooking oil, and flour. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her restaurant into a hotel, to serve more customers and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more serving utensils, tables, rice, bunches of bananas, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
Fortune is an 18-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Fortune was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Fortune is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Fortune comes from Mutare, Zimbabwe and is one of a family of eight. Growing up in Zimbabwe, Fortune was surrounded by high levels of unemployment. He recognised early on that unemployment was a major challenge to the economic and social development of his country. It is Fortune’s long-term goal to bring about change to address this pressing social issue.

Fortune identified and addressed a need in his community when he noticed the unpleasant surroundings of the local hospital near his boarding school. Fortune felt the need to improve the area as it had become a breeding ground for mosquitos and snakes. He appealed to his fellow classmates to help the hospital personnel tidy up the surroundings of the hospital. He managed to mobilize a group of students to pick up papers and cut the long grass around the hospital – efforts that were recognized by the nurse in charge of the hospital.   This is now an on-going project.

A natural leader, Fortune has held multiple leadership positions. In Zimbabwe, leadership roles he assumed included: Sports Commissioner (co-ordinating sporting activities at his school), a junior leader at his church, the chairman for Kutama Cricket Fund-Raising Committee, and  duty-boy at his school (waking up earlier than the others to ensure that everyone woke up on time and issuing cleaning materials for students who needed to use them). In addition to the numerous leadership positions he held, Fortune was still able to excel academically and was even named the best student in Economics in his high school in Zimbabwe. “A good leader needs to manage their time well,” says Fortune.

An aspiring businessman, Fortune’s entrepreneurial flair was recognised by pan-African bank, Ecobank, when he submitted a business plan to the bank for a business competition. Ecobank praised Fortune for his entrepreneurial ability and acknowledged that they were interested in supporting his plan so that he could execute it in the future.

In twenty years’ time, Fortune sees himself as a large-scale social entrepreneur in Africa. He wants to build businesses that provide services that will seek to address the problems that the continent will be facing at that time.  He wants to partner with other people who are passionate about developing the continent to maximize the impact of their work and contributions to the continent.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Sinesipho

texts.en:
Sinesipho is an 18-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

She was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Sinesipho is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Sinesipho is from Port Elizabeth, South Africa, and her leadership journey began when she was very young. After losing both of her parents at a very young age, Sinesipho decided to start a support group for girls who had been in similar situations. Despite the hardships she has suffered, Sinesipho was able to use her experience to positively impact the lives of others. She served on the support group as chairperson and met with the group of girls every day after school to provide them with an avenue to talk about their problems and to see beyond the challenges they were facing.  
 
Sinesipho was involved in several extra-curricular activities at her school and even served as the speaker of the Debate Society. Academically, Sinesipho is also a high achiever. She was consistently ranked among the top ten students in her grade. 

Sinesipho’s passion lies in journalism and drama. She has written poetry for which she has won several awards.  She was also cast as the main character in a short film called “When the Truth Comes Out.” During the World Cup in South Africa, Sinesipho received a wonderful opportunity to intern as a writer for ESPN and Global Girls Media in Johannesburg. Through this experience, her keen interest in journalism and drama was cemented.

Sinesipho is a born leader who shows an outstanding ability to lead herself and others, and she stands up for what she believes in despite what other people may think. A prime example of this was when her school didn’t have a life sciences teacher and Sinesipho went out of her way to have the principal find a replacement.

Sinesipho is passionate about bringing change to Africa. She says that she wants to impact Africa by telling untold stories and giving people a voice through her journalism.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Rafael Ernesto

texts.es: Rafael Ernesto de cincuenta y siete años de edad  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace treinta y siete años, el tiempo de trabajo le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Rafael es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, se dedica al máximo a su labor porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo mucha perdida por eso en esta cosecha quiere recuperarse, pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, etc. Rafael Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que ofrecerá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Rafael Ernesto, 57, lives with his life companion and their children in a house of his own.  He has been growing corn and beans for 37 years.  The time he’s been working has led to his gaining vast experience that translates to getting the best harvests.  His parcel of farmland is located in a zone that’s apt for agriculture and very near where he lives.  He sells all around the area and has acquired a large clientele that always prefers him because everything he sells is top quality at accessible prices and above all with excellent service.

Rafael is an enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead and is always on the lookout for opportunities that will lead to the path to success.  He strives to the maximum degree at work because he knows that this is the only way to attain success.

He suffered significant losses in the previous harvest and wants to recuperate with this one but needs capital to back him up which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.  Rafael Ernesto has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Maximiliano es de Ciudad del Este, es casado, tiene 1 hijo menor  que aún está cursando el colegio secundario. Maximiliano tiene un taller mecánico en su propia casa, donde atiende a todos sus clientes.
Gracias al trabajo que está realizando educa a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar. Siempre fue una persona con ganas de crecer y con mucha visión.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos que utilizará en su taller mecánico, ya que de esa forma podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mr. Maximiliano is from Ciudad del Este, is married and has 1 minor child who is currently in high school. Maximiliano has a garage for repairs in his own home from where he sees all his clients. Thanks to the work that he is carrying out, he is able to educate his children and buy all the necessities for his home. He has always been a person who is eager to grow and who has a lot of vision. He is asking for this loan to purchase spares which he will use in his garage, as by doing so he will be able to provide a better service for his clients.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 36 years old and single with one child, age 12 years old. Josphine runs a food stall business and has been in operation for 8 years, earning 15,000 KES monthly. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD of 30,000 KES. She plans to use it on purchasing a fridge for storing the perishable products. With the anticipated profits, she will do small-scale farming so as to cut down costs of purchasing some vegetables and grains. 

Her hope and dream is that her business prospers so as to earn more profits and open a big hotel.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge for use in her business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for 4 years now. Sophia is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver and they live together at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income to support the husband to feed and clothe their children. Sophia will use her loan to purchase hair wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer to work with. With the new profit, Sophia will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase hair wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer to work with.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow. She sells palm oil at Jukwa near Abura. She has been selling palm oil for 10 years now. Abena is responsible for the upkeep of her 3 children. Abena will use her loan to purchase gallons of oil and palm fruit for her oil to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to produce in large quantity.

loans.use: purchase gallons of oil and palm fruit to produce her oil to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells cloth and fabrics at Jukwa near Abura, which she has done for 11 years now. She is married and has 2 children. Elizebeth uses her income to support the husband to pay their accommodation bills. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase African print cloth and fabric for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase African print cloth and fabric for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building a ground-floor room.

loans.name: Fiorella Carolina

texts.es:
Fiorella es una joven de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con su padres y su pequeña hija, lastimosamente es madre soltera, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Fiorella no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Fiorella trabaja día a día como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fiorella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación, para la cual comprará materiales como adobe, cemento, cañas, arena y otros; de esta manera Fiorella tendrá una habitación donde podrá vivir con su pequeña hija, con ello espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia,  así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que al lado de su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Fiorella, 21, is a young woman living in the city of Ica with her parents and little girl.  Sadly, she’s a single mother.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic woman who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Because of the lack of economic resources and because she needed to go to work she was unfortunately unable to study nursing like she would have liked to but would very much like to do so someday.  In her free time she enjoys relaxing listening to music and sometimes cooks a delicious “Ají de Gallina” to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Fiorella works day to day as a laborer on a large agricultural estate in her city.  She heads out to her place of work very early every morning to start work.  She might work up to 12 hours daily and believes she does well because of the good way she carries out her duties and because of the kind way she treats others.

Fiorella is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided her she will be able to build a room.  To do so, she will buy supplies like adobe, cement, sugarcane stalks, sand and others.  In this way, Fiorella will have a room to live in with her little girl and she hopes this way to provide better security and wellbeing for her family and she can continue working and striving so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Dania Maribel

texts.es:
La  Señora Dania tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio del Progreso, Departamento de Yoro.
Doña Dania manifiesta que debido a la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos decidió establecer hace 8 años un negocio de venta de productos plásticos como: canastas, cubetas, platos, vasos, tasas y cucharas.
Ella vende sus productos en su vivienda y de manera ambulante, actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 7,000 Lempiras para adquirir más variedad de productos y ampliar su inventario.
Considera que con el apoyo financiero obtenido ha mejorado sus ingresos, lo cual le ha proporcionado independencia económica ya que anteriormente dependía de los ingresos de su esposo.
texts.en: Dania, 37, is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her family in the town of Progreso, Yoro Department.  She states that due to the need of generating higher income she decided 8 years ago to start a business selling plastic items like baskets, buckets, dishes, glasses, cups and spoons.  She sells her products at home and from place to place.  She is currently asking for a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy more variety of items and expand her inventory.  She believes that she has improved her income with the financial help she’s gotten which has provided her with economic independence since she used to depend on her husband’s income.

loans.use: to buy plastic items (baskets, drinking glasses, plates, cups).

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de sesenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha dado experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mejorar cada día mas su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona especial para la siembra, con tierra muy fértil, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque todo es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio excelente; Daniel es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para ganarse un futuro prospero, se esfuerza al máximo porque sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, en la ultima cosecha tuvo perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso hará una nueva inversión y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Daniel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la  le confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is sixty three years old and lives with his life partner and their children; he dedicates himself to agriculture and especially to the cultivation of corn and beans. He has been working in the business for various years which provides him with very valuable experience, allowing him to improve his work every day and obtain the best crops.

His land is located in a special area for planting, with very fertile land; he trades all around the area and already has many clients as people prefer [his products] given everything is top quality with accessible prices and excellent service. Daniel is a man dedicated to his work, willing to give his all for a prosperous future, putting in his maximum effort as he knows this is how he will reach success. 

There were losses from the last harvest and he wishes to recover from this so he will make a new investment and solicits a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, etc. Daniel has good references, ensures that he will be able to pay his debt and has the confidence he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Aminata. She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 4. 

In 2009, Aminata established her cooking utensils business. She began her business to help her husband, who is a miner, to run the affairs of the home and to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,816,625 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to increase her stock of cooking utensils. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 781,148 SLL. 

In the future, Aminata plans to be able to grow the business and make more profit and be able to take care of the educational bills of her children. The competition is high, but with more customers, she is able to cope. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking utensils

loans.name: Junisa

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Junisa. He is married and has 5 children, ages 2, 4, 9, 12 and 16. 

In 1996, Junisa established his used clothing business. He began his business to be self-sustainable. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,850,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Junisa has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 427,500 SLL. In the future, Junisa plans to be able to expand to market areas out of the city. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing

loans.name: Encarnacion Dolores

texts.es: Encarnación Dolores de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en su casa de habitación. Encarnación posee una parcela en la cual se dedica a trabajar sembrando maíz y frijoles,  así mismo se dedica a la comercialización de estos, labor a la cual le ayudan sus hijos. Para poder contar con una fuente de ingresos mientras espera que a que la cosecha esté lista, él trabaja como jornalero para otras personas.  Encarnación solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en la compra de abono para sus cosechas y de este modo brindar u mejor servicio, lo que le permita contar con clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Encarnación Dolores, 52, lives with his wife and children in his home.  Encarnación has a plot of land where he makes a living growing corn and beans.  He also sells these products, a job his children help him with.  To be able to have a source of income while he waits for the harvest, he works as a day laborer for other people.

Encarnación is requesting a loan from Integral to be able to invest in buying fertilizer for his harvests and so offer better service, which will allow him to have regular customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vida Nueva Group

texts.es:
El comité Vida Nueva es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, lo integran 13 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante. Estas mujeres se destacan en su barrio por la unión que tiene y por el gran deseo de superación que les desborda.
Teodora comenta que tiene un pequeño kiosco con todo tipo de productos, como ser golosinas, galletitas, bebidas, cigarrillos, comestibles y demás, con lo que ella trabaja y de esa forma dignamente se gana la vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esos productos que vende, para que así tenga bien surtido su negocio y así cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Vida Nueva” (New Life) committee is from the city of San Ignacio.  It has 13 members who are very hardworking women who very much want to get ahead.  They stand out in their neighborhood for the unity they have and for the great drive for self-improvement that overflows from them.

Teodora mentions that she has a small kiosk stocked with all sorts of products like sweets, cookies, soft-drinks, cigarettes, food items and others.  This is how she works and earns her livelihood with dignity.  She’s requesting the loan to buy the products she sells so that her kiosk can stay well-stocked and she can meet customer needs.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cookies, soft-drinks, cigarettes, food items and others.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comite de San Miguel  son todas de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 integrantes  muy responzables en sus reuniones, ellas son muy reconocidas en su barrio por el trabajo en conjunto que hacen.
Ines es la presidenta del grupo, ella se define como una persona que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y dar todo lo que su familia necesita. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, es decir remedios yuyos. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace ya es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para revenderlos y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ganándose el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
The “San Miguel” committee is from the city of San Miguel.  It has 17 members who are very responsible in their meetings.  They are very well-known in their neighborhood for the good teamwork they have.

Inés is group president.  She defines herself as a person who always strives to get ahead and give her family everything they need.  She sells natural remedies, that is, herbal products.  She is very proud of what she does because it’s dignified, honest work.  She’s requesting the loan to buy natural remedies to resell and be able to stay in business earning her daily bread.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma vive en la ciudad de Pilar, es artesana, se dedica a hacer cortinados de todo tipo, los comercializa en todo el país, inclusive sus productos van hasta la republica Argentina. Tiene casa propia, donde tiene su local de confecciones.
Ella es una persona con una gran visión de superación, es por ello que siempre trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia. Solicita el préstamo  para comprar en la inversión en telas, hilos, gomas y demás, que necesita para el negocio,  ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs Zulma lives in the city of Pilar, is a craftswoman and dedicates herself to making curtains of all types. She sells them all over the country and her products also go to Argentina. She has her own house from where she works.

She is a person with a great vision of improvement which is why she always works a lot to get ahead and so be able to help her family. She solicits this loan to invest in fabrics, threads, elastic and more, which she requires for her business, as she has a lot of requests and wants to be able to fulfil them.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread and more.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  is a widow. She lives with her 7 dependents at Jukwa, near Abura.  She has been selling plantains and gari (a dish made from cassava) for 30 years. As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  She will use her loan to purchase more plantains to sell. With the extra profits, Abena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
El Sr. Tiburcio es soltero y vive con su hijo Arnaldo, su hijo está cursando cuarto año de la carrera Administración de Empresas.
Tiburcio tiene un negocio propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo. Además de su trabajo, su hijo Arnaldo trabaja en una empresa privada para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en casa propia. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden compran las necesidades de su hogar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maquinarias para poder usar en su imprenta, ya que lo esta necesitando mucho.
texts.en:
Tiburcio is single and lives with his son Arnaldo, who is a student in his fourth year of a business administration degree program. Tiburcio has his own business, which he bought with a lot of effort.  His son also works for a private company and helps him with the household expenses.

They live in their own home.  Thanks to the work they are doing, the are able to buy everything they need for the family.  He is seeking a loan to buy machinery that is greatly needed for his printing shop.

loans.use: to buy machinery.

loans.name: Luis Leonel

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les ha querido brindar el acceso una educación universitaria pero no lo ha podido hacer por falta de recursos, por esto la tienda general que tiene, la cual es la fuente de ingresos de la familia, la trabaja fuertemente todos los días para sacarla adelante y lograr mejorar los ingresos del hogar. Hace un tiempo vivía con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en la ciudad, pero debido a problemas familiares se vieron en la obligación de mudarse hacia el municipio y desde allí Luis se ha venido esforzando para poder captar los clientes que requiere en su negocio y poder superar las dificultades económicas que tienen actualmente, pues el hecho de ser nuevos en el sector hace que sus ventas aún sean muy bajas. Gracias a su arduo trabajo sus ventas han venido creciendo, y es por esto que Luis busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio con productos que se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio reconocido en el sector que le permita tener mejores ventas y así mejores ingresos para su familia, permitiéndole gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una universidad.
texts.en:
Luis is married and has two children he’s wanted to provide with a university education but has been unable to do so for lack of resources.  This is why he works so hard in his grocery store to make it successful and earn higher profits because it’s the family source of income.

Some time ago he lived with his wife and two children in the city but due to family problems they had to move to the countryside and Luis has been working from there trying to capture customers his store needs so that he can overcome the economic difficulties he has at present because being new to the area his sales are very low.  Thanks to his hard work, sales have been increasing and this is why Luis needs a loan to buy basic staples to stock his store with the goods he’s run out of. 

His dream is for the store to become well-known in the sector so that sales will increase and thus his family income will too leading to better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to offer his two children access to a university.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Desde hace unos 8 años Irma vive con sus 2 hijos en el municipio donde llegó buscar mejores oportunidades laborales luego de haber sido abandonada por su esposo y quedar como madre soltera cabeza de hogar. Aprovechando una oportunidad que le brindaron, Irma montó su propio negocio de venta de pollos asados el cual le ha permitido durante los últimos años sostener los gastos de su hogar y ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Debido a que presenta inconvenientes en un refrigerador donde conserva los pollos para asar, Irma busca un préstamo para reparar el congelador que tiene averiado y poder continuar con su actividad.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y desde el cual tenga la oportunidad de ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en: Irma has been living with her two children for about 8 years in the town where she arrived looking for better work opportunities after her husband abandoned her and she was left as a single mother, head of household.  Taking advantage of an opportunity she was given, Irma started her own roasted chicken business which has made it possible for her to cover household expenses these last few years and to offer her family a good quality of life.  Because the freezer she uses to store the chickens to be roasted is broken this creates a problem for her and Irma is looking for a loan to repair it so that she can continue with her business.  Her dream is to have a larger business where she can generate employment for those most in need and from which she can have the opportunity to offer her two children a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to repair her freezer.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has 2 children. She is a petty trader who has been selling yams at Jukwa, near Abura, for 5 years now. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. She will use this loan to purchase more yams to sell. With the new profits she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Remanso Group

texts.es:
El Comite Primavera esta ubicado en el Chaco Paraguayo, esta en el segundo ciclo, y las integrantes del grupo ven una gran esperanza en su grupo, es por eso que ponen todo de ellas para poder seguir y trabajar juntas.
Ledy por ejemplo vende ropas usadas, y cuenta que con mucho sacrificio da a su familia para el día a día, ya que la vida es muy dura, pero ella no se desanima nunca, es por ello que siempre lucha y da lo mejor de sí.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, ya que desea poder tener más prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y a la vez atraer a más. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de kiva y fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The community bank Primavera is located in Chaco Paraguayo and is in its second loan cycle.  The members have great hopes for this group.  For this reason they give everything they have in order to continue working together.

For example, Ledy sells used clothing and makes a lot of sacrifices every day for her family since life is very difficult.  However, she never lets this get her down; she always fights and gives the best that she has.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy second-hand clothing.  She wishes to have a greater variety of clothing to offer her current customers and at the same time attract new ones.  She and her group are grateful for this opportunity from Kiva and the Paraguay Foundation.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Bella Vista de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 13º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2011.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Remigia ella tiene 4 hijos,  es soltera y ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de frutas y verduras. Cuenta la Sra. Remigia que solicita crédito  para la compra de  frutas y verduras para vender a sus clientes, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda el crédito.
texts.en:
This “Bella Vista” group is from the city of Encarnación; it arose thanks to contact made by one of the members with the Fundación.  It’s in its 13th cycle and has been operating with the Fundación since 2011.

One of the group members is Remigia.  She’s single and has four children.  She’s been selling fruit and vegetables for several years.  Remigia relates that she asked for financing to buy fruit and vegetables to sell to her customers.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because the loan will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, tiene la edad  de 55 años, está casada, vive con su esposo  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer algunos trabajos que mejoren las condiciones y hacer la compra de algunas plantas de café para mejorar la densidad de plantas por área  y con esto aumentaría la producción, también la compra de fertilizantes y algunos fungicidas y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y hacer los trabajos lo más pronto posible y aplicar los fertilizantes  a tiempo para que la cosecha  tenga un buen desarrollo y la maduración sea de buena calidad y abundante, con los ingresos que pueda obtener pretende invertir más y cumplir algunas metas familiares. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rita, 55, is married living with her husband who is her greatest priority.  She intends to use the loan to do work that improves conditions and to buy some coffee plants to improve the area density and increase production this way; she will also buy fertilizer and some fungicide to insure that good work is done.  In addition to being able to buy better products and do the chores as quickly as possible and apply fertilizer in time so that the crops will develop properly and crop yields will be good quality and abundant, she intends to use income obtained to reinvest more and to reach some family goals.  This is her first Fudecosur loan.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is single and has 4 children for whom she has to provide. She has been selling bananas at Wiomoa, near Abura, for 4 years. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nalushomba est  présidente du groupe de crédit Pacifique, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 9 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes au marché de Nyabushongo. Son mari est chômeur depuis plusieurs années. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses pairs des activités de cette IMF dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 5eme cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires évoluent positivement. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé nouveaux investissements importants pour sa famille (chaises, poste radio, etc.). Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 9 coupes de pagnes et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et accroitre son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The customer, Nalushomba, is the president of the Pacifique Group. She is a courageous 46-year-old woman entrepreneur, mother of nine children, all of them in school. Her husband has been unemployed for several years.
