Pour ce faire, Yvette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJRO OKLOUNONTON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The DJRO OKLOUNONTON group consists of three members who live in the same locality in Benin.

Yvette, the group's representative, is the one raising her hand in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its activity.  

Yvette is 42 years old and married to a retailer named Séïdou.  Yvette and Séïdou have eight children who are all in their care.  Some of their children attend school.  Parents and children live together, and the couple jointly takes care of the various expenses of the household.  Yvette never attended school. 

Yvette has been selling telephone recharge cards and various products, in her neighborhood, for almost fifteen years.   Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She buys her goods locally, in her region.

In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Yvette would like to boost and diversify her activity.  This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the DJRO OKLOUNONTON  group. 

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards and various products.

loans.name: Leisy Marilif

texts.es:
Leisy, está decidida a seguir trabajando en su negocio, que es una  tienda de  víveres y de cereales, nos ha solicitado otro préstamo para la compra de maíz en quintal, concentrados, gas, carnes, embutidos, boquitas entre otros.
El crédito anterior tuvo mucho beneficio ya que le ayudo a aumentar el inventario y a diversificar los productos, para darle una mejor atención al cliente. Su hogar ha mejorado y su propósito es poner ladrillo al piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Leisy is dedicated to continue with her business, a store selling groceries and grains. She is requesting another loan to purchase corn, concentrates, propane, meats, sausages, snacks and other items. The previously loan was very beneficial since it helped her increase her inventory and diversify her products, giving her better customer service. Her household has improved and her goal is to pave her home's floor.

loans.use: to purchase corn, concentrates, propane, meats and sausages.

loans.name: Prafulla

texts.en: Prafulla is a married woman, age 41, from the village of Hata Muniguda in the Rayagada District of Odisha, India. She has a small family comprised of her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a daily wage earner working in a rice mill and earning a monthly wage of 6,000 Indian rupees (INR) with which it is very hard to maintain the family. In spite of her awareness, with this small income source, she was not capable of building a toilet for the family. So they are bound to go outside for defecation and suffer from many health hazards which results in financial burden. Prafulla says, "It is really very painful for us to go outside for defecation because it relates to social prestige." So Prafulla wants to invest this 20,000 INR loan in the construction of a toilet to save her family from the social embarrassment as well as the many health problems. In her sentiments she also says that she will be very happy to have a toilet in her house because of her two grown-up girls.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a toilet

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena de 24 años de edad, es una joven madre de familia quien vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad quienes dependen por completo de ella. Morena posee una pequeña parcela en la cual se encarga de sembrar maíz y frijoles, los cuales posteriormente comercializa por mayor a diferentes clientes, su negocio es bastante estable, en el cual desea invertir en lo más posible, ya que es gracias a este como ella logra sostener a su familia. Morena solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar todos los productos necesario para el cuidado de sus plantaciones, tales como abono, pesticidas, maíz, así de esta forma ella espera poder mejorar su trabajo y poder brindar un mejor servicio sus clientes.
texts.en: Morena is 24 years old and is a young mother.  She lives with her mother and her two children, ages 1 and 4, who are completely dependent on her.  Morena has a small parcel of land on which she grows corn and beans, which she then sells wholesale to different customers.  Her business is quite stable, and she wants to invest in it as much as possible, since her business allows her to support her family.  Morena is asking for a loan so she can purchase all of the products she needs to care for her plants, such as fertilizer, pesticides, and corn seed.  She hopes that these inputs will improve her crops so she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to care for her plants.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a clothing business, which she has been operating for 3 years. Sarah started the business from a ‘merry go round’: a self-help scheme where members contribute equal amounts and lend the money to one person at a time.

Sarah learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuation and inflation, and taxes. 

Sarah is applying for a loan of 10,250 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings. Her dream is to open other clothing businesses in other areas.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. 

She owns a clothes business that she has operated for three years. Sarah started the business from a "merry go round": a self-help scheme where members contribute equal amounts and lend the money to one person at a time.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuations and inflation, and taxes. 

Furaha is applying for a loan of KES 10,250 to purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her savings. 

Her dream is to open other clothes businesses in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. 

Christine owns a retail shop that sells juice, bottled water, sweets, etc. and the business has been operating for 5 years. She started the business through her personal savings. Apart from this, she is also employed.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Christine is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to renovate the shop and purchase fat, sugar, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and purchase fat, sugar, water, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Malindi of Coast Province, Kenya. She has three children who all attend school. She owns a food cafe - a business that she has been operating for 2 years. She sells rice, beans, potatoes, etc.

Eunice learned about Milango through an employee with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is low income during the low season.

Eunice is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, and potatoes for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's standard of living. She aspires to open a big restaurant in future.

loans.use: to buy some flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, and potatoes for the cafe.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is grateful for the support given her through her last loan. She says that she was able to increase her inventory in her vegetable stall. 

Since she has seen it become a profitable business, she is asking for a new loan so as to expand her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy fruits and vegetables. 

Her goal is open a cereal shop in future. She promises to make her payments on time so as to ask for more loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is requesting a new loan because she considers it necessary to purchase more merchandise for her shoes and accessory business. 

Dorcas is motivated with her work on the stall, since it will allow her to support the needs of her household. With the help she's being given, she has more security. She has kept a good number of customers thus far.

With this new loan, she will buy more stock of shoes and accessories for resale.  Her aspirations are to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of shoes and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a devoted mother who always tries to use every opportunity that comes across. She still operates her spare parts selling business, which has enabled her to cater for her household expenses without great burden. 

Anna has returned to Yehu and Kiva to request her third loan to invest in her business. She has a good credit reference, since she has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

With this loan, she will increase her stock of spare parts and be able to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu lives with her four children.  She is dedicated to selling spare parts, a business she loves because it gives what she requires. She depends on this business to earn a living and provide for the needs of her home. 

She requests a new loan to invest in the purchase of more spare parts. This loan will allow her business to increase sales and improve her daily life.

Her goal is to improve her customer service, so her economic situation is not affected, and she can give a better economic stability to her children.

loans.use: To purchase of more spare parts.

loans.name: Ephata Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ushindi est un membre du groupe de crédit Ephata, jeune femme dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, sans enfant, nouvellement mariée. Elle est vendeuse dans sa propre quincaillerie. Elle s’entraide avec son mari qui est quincailleur. Avant de se marier, elle fut initiée par son père qui est aussi quincailleur. Ainsi, donc, cette cliente maîtrise parfaitement ce secteur de matériaux de construction. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 5eme crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec un lot de matériels électriques. En plus, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle dans le futur entant donné qu’ils sont encore de nouveaux mariés. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The borrower,  Ushindi, is a member of the Ephata credit group.  She is a dynamic young entrepreneur, age 22, who recently got married and doesn't have any children yet.  

She is a salesperson in her own hardware store and she works with her husband who is also a hardware seller.  Ushindi learned her trade from her father before getting married, and she is now quite an expert in the field of construction supplies.  Her father also worked in hardware.

Ushindi uses the profits from her business to put some money into savings and to buy food.  

She has now just received her fifth loan and plans to use it to buy some electric supplies.

In the future, she and her husband would like to buy a plot of land as they are still newlyweds.

Ushindi thanks Hekima for helping low-income women become independent.  

It should be noted that, [in the photo], some of the borrowers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy electric supplies.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, es casado y tiene tres hijos dos de los cuales ya son independientes y el ultimo esta en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día  en una empresa confeccionando buzos deportivos y también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes que es  administrada por  su esposa ( que aparece en la foto adjunta) ya que ambos solventan los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina recta para la confección de los buzos deportivos ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos de forma independiente.
El sueño de Genaro, es conseguir  una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, y lo más importante, ahorrar los alquileres que actualmente paga.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Genaro is married and has three children, two of whom are already independent; the youngest is school-aged. They live in a rented house, occupying three rooms. The house is located in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than eight hours a day in a company making tracksuits, and also has a grocery store run by his wife, who appears in the above photo. Both of them contribute to their family's expenses for food, education and payment of basic services. 

He needs the loan for the purchase of a single-needle sewing machine for making tracksuits, as he wishes to improve his income by working independently.

Genaro's dream is to obtain a house through "anticrético" (lump-sum loan in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to the occupant at the end of the contract). This is in order to give his family more comfort, improve their quality of life, and most important, to not have to pay the rent that he currently pays.

It is the first time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a single needle sewing machine for starting his own business making tracksuits.

loans.name: Tereza Elena

texts.es:
Tereza de 36 años, una mujer soltera sus estudios llegaron hasta nivel primario,  trabaja para mantener a sus 3 hijos de doce, diez y seis años quienes apoyan a Tereza en su trabajo. Viven en el Barrio de la Cooperativa 20 de Octubre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad de Ecuador muy importante que está entre las 4 más pobladas y su economía se mueve gracias a las actividades agrícolas, ganaderas, y el turismo ya que existen varios lugares que son atractivos para turistas nacionales e internacionales, por lo que la comercialización de artesanías, hoteles, transporte y comida es muy común en el centro de esta ciudad.
Tereza usa  el arte culinario para subsistir, ella cocina y vende “encebollados” comida típica del lugar, elaborado a base de pescado y vegetales, inició su negocio hace un año con una pequeña cocina  y por el rico sabor de su comida ha conseguido que varios clientes la prefieran por lo que Tereza quiere invertir y abrir otro lugar para poder vender más encebollados y de esta manera poder hacer que todos sus hijos puedan estudiar. El sueño de esta mujer trabajadora es  llegar a tener un gran restaurante donde venda una gran variedad de comidas por esto ella está en busca de su primer crédito y sabe que con trabajo y el sabor de sus comidas le irá muy bien.
texts.en: Tereza is 36 years old, single and has a primary-school education. She works to provide for her three children, ages 12, 10 and 6, who help her with her business. They live in the Cooperativa 20 de Octubre neighborhood in the city of Santo Domingo, one of Ecuador's most important cities. It is among the four most populated and has a bustling economy thanks to the agriculture, livestock and tourism industries. There are a number of attractive sights nearby for domestic and international tourists, so artwork, hotels, transportation and food services are very common in the city center. Tereza uses culinary art to make a living. She cooks and sells "encebollados", a traditional local dish made with fish and vegetables. She started her business a year ago in a small kitchen, and thanks to the rich flavor of her food she has acquired numerous customers, so Tereza wants to invest and open another location so she can sell more encebollados and in this way she can afford for all of her kids to go to school. The dream of this hardworking woman is to come to have a great restaurant selling a wide variety of foods, which is why she is requesting her first loan. She knows with work and the flavor of her food that things will go very well.

loans.use: to open a new location.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche como chofer propietario de un taxi, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que desea cambiar algunos repuestos (filtro de aire, liquidos para frenos, pastillas para frenos y mantenimiento en general) ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Efraín, es mejorar sus ingresos para conseguir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Efraín is single, and has a school-aged son. He lives in his parents' home, occupying a single, small room with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than 10 hours a day and until late at night driving the the taxi that he owns. His must cover his family's expenses for education, food and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan for maintaining his vehicle. He wishes to replace some parts (air filter, brake pads), replace the brake fluid and do general maintenance, as this is the only source of work he has for supporting his family.

Efraín's dream is to improve his income in order to obtain a house through "anticrético" (lump-sum loan provided in exchange for housing tenure, where the loan must be paid back to the lender/occupant at the end of a specified period). This is in order to provide more comfort to his family, as he wishes to improve their quality of life.

This is the third time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To pay expenses for maintaining his taxi.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is 41 years old. She has a small retail shop which she has run since 2003. She is a very enterprising and hardworking person. She notes that she began with a small business and that later, thanks to hard work and sacrifice, began adding more products. Her goal is to continue growing so that she will have better earnings for the day to day needs. Nyamvula is married and has seven children.

She is applying for a loan to purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking fat and other supplies to stock her shop. She describes price fluctuations to be her major challenge.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking fat and other supplies

loans.name: Egga

texts.en:
Egga is 46 years old and is married to Joto, who is a farmer. Together they have two grown children. She has been a housewife for long until she was able to start a business out of her home. She started her own business in 2004, and she already has a large base of customers.

She presently buys and sells goats at the market. However, she does not go to the market herself; instead, her older son operates it for her. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Ega

texts.en: Ega comes from the town of Samburu. She is very hardworking, as evinced day after day by all her efforts. She is a shopkeeper. She has a locale she uses as a general store, which she opens for business very early in the morning. Ega is a married mother who has 8 children. Thanks to all her efforts; she has been able to educate her children despite her advanced age. Ega was one of the first in her neighborhood to have a general store, and thus has a very strong customer base. In spite of her age, her goal is to make her business keep growing, and this is why she asks for this loan. She wishes to invest the funds in her shop and supply it with sugar, flour, rice, detergents, and other supplies. She is thankful for the opportunity granted by the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, detergents, and other supplies

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama, 40, is married and has seven children. She tells us that she has a well-stocked store that supplies her neighborhood. She says that she started with a small vegetable stall, and then she decided to change her business and make a living through the store, which is going very well for her. She has good customers since she is friendly with them and all of her business's products are priced well.

Salama is requesting this loan to buy sugar, tea leaves, beans, rice, and drinks. This will help her business to have a good stock and give her family what it needs. She describes herself as a hard-working person with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, beans, rice, and drinks.

loans.name: Juhaje

texts.en:
Juhaje is 50 years old. She is a widow and all her children are adults and independent. She lives in her modest home in the town of Samburu.
She has been a merchant for over 5 years. She began selling livestock,with her husband. Her son is in charge of it now. Juhaje requests the loan to purchase more goats for sale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support and the confidence that they have shown her.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Torojani est le membre et le président du groupe Abunzubumwe / Kzh. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres unis».Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 2 ans  à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Torojani est cultivateur de riz. C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Torojani is a member and the president of the Abunzubumwe / Kzh group.  The name of the group means "United members".  He is 40 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages range between 2 and 16 years.  Four of his children are in school.  Torojani's own level of education is six years of secondary school.

Torojani is a rice farmer.  This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB.  According to him, his previous loan really helped his rice farming business, and he is not expecting any repayment difficulty for this current loan.  He will use this loan to buy some fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor for his rice-growing business.

In order to boost his rice farming business, Trojan is planning to request additional loans, which will help him to increase his rice-growing capacities.  In the coming years, he would like to be the best rice producer in his region.  He is planning to use his profits to pay for his children's school fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr: PELAGIE est une femme mariée, agée de 32ans  mère de 02 enfants. Elle est couturière dans un quartier de la capital où elle fait dans la couture mixte, elle a 06 apprentis et  un permanant. PELAGIE coud sur commande et fait également l'exposition. Grace à son savoir faire et à son expérience dans ce domaine, elle a conquis et fidelisée une clientèle au fil de temps. La croissance continuelle de cette clientèle rend son offre inférieur à la demande. Face à cette situation, elle aimerait prendre un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter des tissus pour augmenter le stock pour la confection des habits, un mannequin pour l'exposition et une machine à coudre. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d'affaires et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera une partie de ce bénéfice pour la scolarisation de ses enfants à l'école et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Pelagie is a married woman, who is 32 years of age and mother to two children. She works as a seamstress in a neighborhood in the capital, where she carries out a wide variety of sewing. She has six apprentices, as well as one permanent member of staff.

Pelagie works to order, and also makes display items. Thanks to her know-how and experience in this field, she has built up a loyal customer base over time. The constant growth in customer numbers means that supply is lower than demand. Faced with this situation, Pelagie would like to take out a loan so that she can buy fabrics to increase her stock for dressmaking, a mannequin for display purposes, and a sewing machine. This will increase her sales and, consequently, her profit margin. Pelagie plans to save part of these profits for her children’s education, and will reinvest the rest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, a mannequin, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Leonor De Jesus

texts.es:
Leonor, está solicitando otro crédito, por la buena atención que Padecomsm crédito le brinda y  porque  necesita  comprar insumos para surtir la tienda por ejemplo: comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, y otros productos para la tienda.
Expresa que el crédito anterior tuvo un gran efecto, ya que le ayudo a fortalecer su vivienda con la compra de puertas y ventanas de balcon, con su negocio y con las ganancias a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, se ha mantenido en el mercado y ha crecido en términos de ingresos y clientes.
texts.en:
Leonor is requesting another loan as a result of the good management of the credit that PADECOMSM has given her. She needs to buy merchandise to restock her store such as rice, beans, oil, and other products.

Leonor says that her previous loan had a great effect. It helped to secure her home since she was able to buy doors and balcony windows. In her business, the earnings she generated helped her family to move forward. She has maintained her standing in the marketplace and has grown in terms of her income and the number of customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus suegros ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas realizando todo trabajo de chaperia y pintura de vehículos ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de pintura y material para realizar sus trabajos en su taller de chaperia ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Justo, es conseguir un anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
Para una mayor información, un Anticrético es un acuerdo legal entre el dueño de casa o de departamento y un potencial inquilino para que este último pueda  vivir por un tiempo no mayor a dos años, por una suma de dinero entregada a la firma del acuerdo y que será devuelta a la finalización del acuerdo. De esta manera, el inquilino logra ahorrar un dinero que de otra manera lo hubiera gastado si viviese en alquiler.
texts.en:
Justo is married, and has two school-aged children. They live in their in-laws' house, occupying a single small room with adobe walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than ten hours a day, doing all kinds of bodywork, and vehicle painting. He is the only one covering his family's expenses for education, food, and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan to buy paint and materials for carrying out his work in his auto body shop, as he wishes to improve his income. 

Justo's dream is to get an "anticrético," in order to provide more comfort to his family and improve their quality of life. 

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

As additional information, an "anticrético" is a legal agreement between the owner of a house or apartment and a potential tenant. It enables the latter to live in it for a period not greater than two years, in exchange for a sum of money delivered at the signing of the agreement, which will be returned at the termination of the agreement. This way, a tenant manages to save the money that they otherwise would have spent if they were to live in rented premises.

loans.use: To buy paint, sandpaper and other supplies, for his business repairing and painting vehicles.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is from the town of Samburu. She’s married to Mwaruphe, a teacher by profession, and her family includes five children, all of whom are dependent.

Mwanamisi has a home-based general store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her store like detergents, sugar, salt, flour and other things to stock her store with. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for the opportunity she’s receiving because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store like detergents, sugar, salt, flour and other things

loans.name: Dalibeth

texts.es: Dalibeth agradece mucho a los financiadores de Kiva por apoyarla a ella y a su familia mediante su negocio. Ella con su anterior inversión compró mercancía, ropa y calzado,  surtiendo su tenderete y vendiendo cada vez más. Como se acerca la  temporada en que se celebra el día del amor y la amistad y sus ventas se incrementan,  sus clientes han hecho anticipadamente muchos pedidos y su capital de trabajo está representado en sus cuentas por cobrar, por esta razón ha acudido nuevamente a un credikiva, con el cual comprará detalles femeninos, ropa, calzado, accesorios para el hogar, con los cuales los novios, esposos, amigos alegrarán los momentos de celebración. Su credikiva proyecta tener éxito pues se invierte en la mercancía tomada en una labor de preventa, y en una de las épocas más comerciales del año, lo cual garantiza la total rotación de la mercancía.
texts.en:
Dalibeth is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping her and her family by supporting her business. With her previous loan, she was able to buy merchandise, clothing, and shoes to restock her inventory so that she could have more to sell each month. Since Colombian Valentine’s Day is approaching, her sales have been increasing. Her customers have placed many orders in anticipation of this occasion. Dalibeth’s outstanding receivable accounts represent her operating capital, which is why she is requesting another Kiva loan. She will use the money to buy women’s gifts, clothing, shoes, and accessories for the home. These items are suited for significant others, spouses, and friends to celebrate this holiday.

Her Kiva loan is expected to result in success since it will be invested in pre-ordered merchandise for one of the busiest seasons of the year. This will guarantee complete turnover of these products.

loans.use: to buy women’s gifts, clothing, shoes, and accessories for the home.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is 32 years old and a very hardworking young woman. She is a married mother, and her three children are her reason to live and tirelessly fight. 

Luvuno makes a living selling goats at the market where her brother assists her in taking the animals to the market. She tells us that she sacrifices a lot for her work. Her dream is to own a butcher shop in the future. She is grateful for your help because the loan will be very useful. With the loan, she plans to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi, 35, is a married woman living in Samburu, a town in the coastal region of Kenya. From this relationship, she has six children who are all in school.

She has a store that she has maintained for three years. It generates income for her family and pays for the various expenses she has. Thanks to this, she has managed to support her family, because she is a hardworking woman and a fighter, always willing to work without regard for how old she is.

She is requesting this loan to buy bales of flour, sugar and other items that she will offer to her customers to be able to improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her two children and her husband, who is a farmer. She manages a general store, a business that she started out of necessity because she needed to improve her income and provide for her family's needs.

Fatuma is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her store, such as oil, maize flour, sweets, snack foods, sodas, soap and detergents. This loan will help to improve the availability of products in her business so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers. Fatuma's goals are to improve her home, develop her business, and improve her sales in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, such as oil, maize flour, sweets, snack foods, sodas, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Mweruphe

texts.en:
Mweruphe is taking out another loan to expand on the existing business. She has been rearing and selling livestock for a long time; it's a business she enjoys. 

Her previous loan allowed her to add to her animals. She is requesting a new loan to purchase more goats to rear and later sell. She hopes to get more profits, especially this festive season. She promises to pay her loan punctually, as she did the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to rear and later sell.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is still single and she has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2007 and she does her best. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her business so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including coffee, sugar, oil and candles. She lives with her parents but she plays a part in helping her family and she is an independent girl.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, oil, candles and rice.

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es: Katia Elizabeth de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, para damas, caballeros y niños,  posee una gran variedad faldas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, camisas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha reglado mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicado en una zona estrategia muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles con producto de calidad pero sobre todo con un buen servicio. Katia es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, luchadora, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le ayuden a salir adelante, su mas grande secreto es la motivación de alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y eso la impulso a realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita  a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Katia Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Katia Elizabeth is 31 years old and lives with her life companion and their son. She buys and sells clothing for women, men, and children. Katia offers a great variety of skirts, trousers, dresses, suits, shirts, and other items. She has been in business for several years and has gained plenty of experience in making sales. Her business is located in a strategic area that is very busy. She has many customers who prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need at affordable prices. Her products are of high quality, but most of all, she provides good service.

Katia is an active woman who is dedicated to her work. She is determined and always looking for ways to get ahead. Her greatest secret is her motivation to become successful. Demand has increased in recent weeks, so she has decided to make a new investment. However, she does not have sufficient capital and has requested a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy clothing in bulk.

Katia Elizabeth has good payment references and is very responsible. She says that she will be able to repay her debt on time and has faith that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en: Terezinha lives in a town near the city. She is happy to do her business. She said living in a town is very competitive in earning money unless we do some activities that are profitable in order to survive. Looking for ways to earn money, Terezinha came up with the idea of making a place to wash cars. She is applying for a loan to buy materials to wash cars including a washing car machine.

loans.use: to buy a machine to wash cars

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en: Aquilina is 21 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones to sell. She has been doing this mobile phone selling business since 2011 with working capital of $250.00. She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for the roof in the city with her husband.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is 30 years old, married to a policeman and she has five children. She has a kiosk at home. She has come to take her second loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She was very happy with the first loan because she could get a good income. She said that with the income, she wants to make her kiosk bigger and build a good house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and hard drinks

loans.name: Abatebutsi Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Juvénal est le membre et le président du groupe Abatebutsi. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les responsables ».Il a 41 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 an à 7 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Juvénal est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Juvénal is a member and the president of the Abatebutsi group. The name of the group means "the responsible ones."

Juvénal is 41 years old and is married with four children, who range from 1 to 7 years old. Two of the children have been to school. Juvénal attended school himself through junior high.

Juvénal is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor on his farm. 

Juvénal plans to request other loans in order to increase his farming capacity. In the coming years, he would like to be the number one rice producer in the region. He intends to to use his profits to pay for his children's school fees and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor on his rice farm

loans.name: Turwanyubukene / Cymr Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Laurien est le membre et le président du groupe Turwanyubukene / Cymr. Le nom du groupe signifie «Luttons contre la pauvreté ».Il à 61 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 16 an à 41 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Laurien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Monsieur Laurien is a member and the leader of the Turwanyubukene / Cymr group.  The name of the group means, “Let's fight against poverty.”  He is 61 and married with eight children between the ages of 16 and 41 years, two of whom have attended school.  He has had six years of primary school.

Monsieur Laurien grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans for increasing his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
This is Shierly. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Shierly hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good quality education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Unita

texts.en:
From a young age, Unita knew she wanted to take a different path. “I had no footprints to follow,” Unita shared as she reflected on her childhood. “Many people around me lacked the motivation to boost their own economic situation, choosing not to further their education nor pursue avenues of self improvement.” 
 
After receiving a very memorable massage, Unita was inspired to become a massage therapist and she committed to giving, receiving and studying massage therapy. Earning her certification and license, she started working for local spas. Struggling as a single mom and working hard for years under several different employers, Unita decided to act on her drive to start her own business. Knowing that financial literacy would be one of the keys to success, she took advantage of every available workshop or class to prepare herself to be a small business owner.  

It’s been seven years since Unita began working in the massage industry, and she is now seeking a $5,000 Kiva loan to launch her own business and open up her own day spa.  A fully funded Kiva loan will allow her to secure a retail space, purchase equipment and do some initial marketing.

loans.use: to secure a retail space, purchase equipment, and market her new business

loans.name: Oletta

texts.en:
Oletta’s grandmother had fourteen children, and with the vast majority of them remaining local in San Diego, it’s no wonder that she grew up with a strong emphasis on family.  From a young age, Oletta shared the responsibilities of caring for her younger family members, learning from inspirational people such as her grandmother and parents.

After working for several law firms and local government organizations that focused on serving families and youth, she decided to pursue a career in child care and opened her own day care center.  Because of her previous experiences inspecting mismanaged facilities and organizations, Oletta has always emphasized safety, educational enrichment and fair pricing to better service the low-income families in her community.  

Now, eleven years after opening her first day care center in her grandmother’s house, her self-determined, entrepreneurial, “no excuses” mentality continues to drive her to better her facility and the lives of the children she spends every day loving and serving. Oletta will use her Kiva loan to make upgrades to her center, as well as purchase computers and reading material for the children. These upgrades will allow her to attract more clients and further enrich the lives of the children she loves.

loans.use: to pay for new computers, reading materials, and facility improvements.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
After leaving Mexico, Mariana and her husband brought their children to California in search of a better life and brighter future. With their prior careers and qualifications nearly inconsequential here in the US, they searched hard for employment opportunities and soon started working in the cleaning and construction clean-up business. After working ten years for other companies, starting from the bottom and working their way into managerial positions, they decided to start their own business, Genesis Clean Services.  

Now, several years after opening, they have expanded their services, created jobs, and most importantly, taught their children about hard work and responsibility.  Overcoming language and cultural barriers, they embraced the opportunities presented to them and rallied around their family to bring those dreams of a more successful future to realization.  

They were recently offered an amazing business opportunity and are in need of financing to purchase a carpet cleaner to fulfill a new, large contract. The impact of this Kiva loan will ensure the stability and growth of their company for years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a carpet cleaner so she can fulfill a new, large contract for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
After years of trying to balance the challenges of being a young mother with the hectic schedule and stressful environment of pharmacy work, Leah decided to follow her passion and pursued skin care and holistic esthetics. She remembers one particular facial she received when she left feeling reenergized and beautiful. This experience inspired her to seek to provide this type of amazing service for others.  

Always interested in helping others with their health and self-esteem, this field allowed her to follow her passions every day. After receiving several certifications in order to provide a wide breadth of services to her customers, Leah began acting on her personal philosophy. While others in the profession might work solely to create beauty topically, Leah believes, “Beautiful skin begins with healthy skin.”  Dedicated to organic, non-chemical products and remedies, she cultivates beauty from the inside, utilizing a holistic, client-specific approach to her work.  

Leah is looking for a small amount of financing to help promote her business at a local trade show as well as to purchase new beneficial products for her clients. This Kiva loan will bolster her presence and initiate growth for her business. Inspired every day by the happiness on the faces of her clients after receiving treatment, she is determined to reach even more people in her community and provide everybody with the opportunity to feel great and look even better.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and inventory.

loans.name: Machiko

texts.en:
Machiko has always loved orchids. Originally from Japan, Machiko grew up with the Japanese practice of cultivating intricately designed and beautifully cultivated orchid plants. Although orchids are very common in Japan, they are unaffordable to most. However, during a visit to Hawaii over 30 years ago, she was surprised at how accessible orchids were and how easy they were to grow in Hawaii. It was during this time that she first began raising and cultivating orchids with the dream of sharing the beauty of Japanese orchids with everyone she met.

After moving to the US, Machiko refined her orchid planting and cultivating skills. Orchids are among the most difficult flowers to grow and require the perfect balance of water, sun and nutrients to flower. The way Machiko tenderly cares for her orchids demonstrates not only her passion for her craft, but also her expertise in what she does.

Ready to expand her business and sell more orchids, Machiko will use her Kiva loan to build a shade for her plants, increase her planting area and also buy more flowers. She hopes to grow a larger, more beautiful orchid garden to attract more business and inspire people to fall in love with the flower she has loved all these years.

loans.use: to build a shade for her plants, increase her planting area, and buy more inventory.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, She previously accessed a14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma dreams of continuing her business and living a good and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Bei

texts.en:
When she left her native China to come to the United States, Bei arrived anxious to realize her own American Dream. Despite her skill-set and education, she instantly faced challenges, coming to the harsh understanding that the business degree and experience she worked so hard to gain in her home country held no credibility here. With limited employment options, she soon started working as a waitress at the restaurant where her mother managed.  

Like most immigrants, Bei had to rely on her family and community as she struggled to learn a foreign language and assimilate to a new culture, while also trying to figure out how to make her dreams a reality. She shared, “I always had the support of my family, and I knew that if anything went wrong, they would always help me.” 

Bei eventually went to beauty school and received her esthetician and nail tech license in 2010. She started working at a nail salon with a close-knit group of immigrant estheticians who taught her the trade and helped polish her skills. During a visit back to China, Bei learned about reflexology, a type of acupuncture treatment for the feet that helps relieve stress and pain, and she decided to incorporate this practice into her treatments. 

Combining her experience in nail care and reflexology, Bei is now opening her very own salon that promotes both beauty and healthy living. She is seeking a $10,000 Kiva loan to set up her salon, purchase equipment, and install a pedi-chair.  

After years of dedication and self determination, Bei has finally discovered her American Dream. Remembering all those who helped her along the way, Bei is looking to pay it forward. She has a strong desire to create employment opportunities similar to those given to her during the course of her challenging, yet rewarding journey.

loans.use: to set up her salon, purchase equipment, and install a pedi-chair.

loans.name: Nelly Ernestina

texts.es:
Nelly, ha tomado a bien solicitar un préstamo porque necesita capital para invertir en el  negocio en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.
Expresa que el crédito anterior tuvo un efecto muy importante, ya que le permitió tener todo lo necesario para  trabajar, han cambiado las circunstancias  familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
Ella esta motivada con su pequeña granja, ya que le da la ocupacion y a la vez le genera actividad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly has submitted a new loan request because she needs capital to invest in her business. She will buy pigs for fattening so that she can sell them later.

Nelly says that her previous loan had an important effect. It provided her with everything she needed for her work. As a result, her family’s circumstances changed and her financial condition improved. Nelly is motivated to maintain her small farm since it provides her with work and the means to provide financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria cuyes,gallinas y chanchos,la socia vende en las diferentes ferias del distrito de Calca,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar cuyes,gallinas y chanchos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She sells the animals at different fairs within the District of Calca. The member has been in this business for 10 years, but she dreams of owning a restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her animals. In addition, she will buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.

The member is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Johana Yamileth

texts.es:
Johana, está decidida por otro crédito ya que necesita mejorar su negocio de servicios de belleza;El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales tales como: Maquillajes, Esmaltes, Tintes, uñas, plancha, pistola, cremas, espuma, gotas para el cabello, líquidos como champú, jabón, acetona,spray.
El crédito anterior le ayudo en gran manera ya que le permitió a traves de las ganancias, comprar una maquina de cortar pelo. La familia hasta el día de hoy se mantiene, sus ingresos han mejorado sus activos fijos, han mejorado la gama de servicios variando para los gustos, estilos y colores de los clientes.
texts.en:
Johana has decided to request another loan because she needs to improve her beauty business. The money will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as make-up, nail polishes, dyes, press-on nails, a curling iron, a hair dryer, crèmes, hair serum, shampoo, soap, acetone, and sprays.

The previous loan helped in a great way since it allowed her to generate an income. Johana was able to buy a hair clipping machine. To this day, she has been able to support her family and improve her fixed assets. She has also expanded her range of services to include styling and coloring so that she can cater to the tastes of her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, poultry feed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El Sr. Hector tiene 22 años,  el es pescador el vive en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Hector va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una bote pesquero de mayor capacidad su mercadería producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Hector enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el viento que no le permite pescar por el olaje que levanta, Hector es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse.
texts.en: Hector is 22 years old. He is a fisherman abd lives on on island in Lake Titicaca. It is a touristy area in the departament of La Paz, where they offer artisanal crafts made from totora and wool. Most of the residents in this area work in fishing and tourism. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Hector is going to use this loan to buy a bigger fishing boat. He sells his fish in the city of La Paz. With this new boat, he wants to increase his production and thus meet the demand of his customers. Hector faces challenges in his business, such as the wind, which makes waves that don't allow him to fish. Hector is a person who wants to get ahead. He is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered, since this is his only source of income to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a boat

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel tiene 26 años es casada tiene un hijito pequeño de la edad de tres años, ella  se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Isabel va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Isabel  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Isabel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Isabel is 26 years old. She is married and has a three year old son. She sells cosmetics via catalog door to door. She visits homes, and public and private offices in the city of La Paz, offering her products. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Isabel is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics wholesale since they are on sale. This way, she can offer her customers a variety of products and increase her profits. Her reason for asking for this loan is to keep improving her business. Isabel  is going to use the money to buy a variety of cosmetics. Isabel is a very hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity that has been offered.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra.  Isabel tiene 57 ella se dedica a la venta de comida en restaurante que se encuentra en la zona central de la localidad de Sacaba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Isabel  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para la ampliación de su restaurante y así  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Isabel  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Isabel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Isabel is 57 years old. She sells food at a restaurant located in the center of a community called Sacaba. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Isabel is going to use the loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her restaurant and thus offer more comfort to her customers. Her reason for asking for this loan is to keep improving her business. Isabel is going to use the benefits to keep buying materials and thus improving her income. What she wants for her business is to have a chain of restaurants and in this way offer her customers a better service. Isabel is a very hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity that has been offered.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her restaurant

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy, 56, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daisy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Daisy hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sepriati

texts.en: Sepriati has a kiosk and is also selling secondhand clothes. Looking for ways to find more working capital to improve her business, she come to MFI (Tuba Rai Metin) to apply for loan. Tuba Rai Metin is the name of our MFI in the local language, which means "stand firmly on the ground". She will buy books, pens,  coffee, sugar, and clothes with the loan. She want to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, coffee and secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 33-year-old married woman living in Palilan, Jimenez. In order to add income in the family, she entered into a buy and sell of beauty products business 2 years ago. She usually gets about 4,000 PHP per month. With the help of GDMPC Microcredit, Cheryl is able to buy products such as lotion, lipsticks, etc. to sell because of the loan money amounting of 5,000 PHP rendered to her. She joined GDMPC this year. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy products such as lotion, lipsticks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married with 6 children. He is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.

He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 11 years, and every month he earns approximately 4,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Alex is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to finish the studies of his children and to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
This is the fifth loan for the Dewi Fortuna group. They still need loans because most of them need the training and education from the Vet or FO. They want to be successful pig breeders. Now with 10 members, including one who couldn't attend the meeting because of being sick, they will receive the same loan amount. Besides using the loan to purchase piglets, they will also use the loan to fix the barn.

Jero Pudak is happy to receive her loan and use it to purchase 3 superior piglets. Still with the fattening program, she hopes this time she will earn more profit. All the profits are used for supporting the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 3 superior piglets.

loans.name: Saroeut's Group

texts.en:
Saroeut is age 37 years and lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has two children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice farming and raising chickens, and his wife also complements the income by selling fish. They have been in these businesses for fifteen years to support their family. Currently, drought is the main challenge for their business. 

Saroeut’s group consists of two members and they are in the fifth cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have enabled Saroeut to relieve the family’s burden. The group leader, Saroeut, will use his portion to buy rice seeds for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees, as he hired somebody to help in transplanting, plowing and harvesting the paddy-rice. Saroeut hopes to make more income through selling those crops.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Affiavi Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est marié à un secrétaire du nom de Star. Affiavi Célestine est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Affiavi Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Affiavi Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une huitaine d’année que Affiavi Célestine mène comme activité la vente des produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique. Affiavi Célestine mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Affiavi Célestine s’approvisionne au Togo et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Affiavi Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Mahugnon is a group of 3 people whose members lives in the same region of Benin. The group's representative, Affiavi Célestine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 39 years old and married to a secretary called Star. Affiavi Célestine is the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school and are dependent on the couple. Affiavi Célestine lives together with her husband and their children and the couple take care of the various expenses.

Affiavi Célestine did not go to school. She has been selling beauty products in her shop for around 8 years. She has this business so that she can meet the household needs. Affiavi Célestine gets her supplies in Togo and at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Affiavi Célestine is requesting a second loan, together with the other members of the Mahugnon group. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits. The previous loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en: Acquilina is from Dinas, Sinacaban. She is 59 years old. Acquilina is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Acquilina has cultivated coconuts for sale for 20 years and earns 3,500 a month for these activities. In 2010, Acquilina joined GDMPC. Acquilina is requesting a loan of 12,000, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 31, residing in a rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, has two children, both of whom are still in school. To support the family, she has been planting cabbages and cucumbers. She complements her family’s income by selling various kinds of vegetables such as cucumbers, bitter gourd, ridge gourd, long bean and cabbage, etc. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Sophal has been growing vegetables and selling them for thirteen years. 
 
Sophal has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she and her group member are requesting another loan of 600,000KHR and 200,000KHR, respectively. As the leader of the group, Sophal is going to use her potion to buy fertilizers for her plantation and a portion of it to buy more vegetables for selling. She hopes to gain more income from selling vegetables so as to earn a good living for her family, and especially to keep the children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her vegetable planting.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: AÏDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même agglomération au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a huit enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Célestine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de douze ans que Célestine mène comme activité la vente des boules de pâtes (faite à base de l’amidon du maïs) accompagné des poissons frits par le système de distribution. Célestine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AÏDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Aïdote is a group composed of 3 people whose members lives in the same town in Benin. The group's representative, Célestine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 58 years old and married to Jean. The couple have 8 dependent children, all of whom attend, or have attended, school. Célestine and her husband live together with their children and both take care of the various household expenses.

Célestine did not go to school. She has been selling paste balls (made from corn starch) and fried fish via the distribution channel for nearly 12 years. Célestine works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in her region. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Célestine is requesting a 4th loan, together with the other members of the Aïdote group. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish and corn.

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en:
Nou, 32 years old, is a farmer and lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children, two daughters and one son, and they are all of school age. The main source of the family’s income is planting cassava on a one-hectare area of farmland. Also, she generates extra income by raising pigs, which she and her husband have been doing for twenty years. The current business earns them about 35,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Nou is in her second loan with VisionFund and fully repaid the past loan which helped her family to have sufficient foods to eat. Now she is leading her group of three to seek a loan from VisionFund. Nou, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes the loan will allow her to raise the pigs healthily and grow the cassava with good yields so that she can sell them for higher prices. In return her family can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Kan is age 59 years and has seven children. She has made a living through farming rice for thirty-one years, while her husband is a village chief in the local area. One of her children is staying with her and helps at the rice field. After netting off the expenses, Kan manages to save about US$5 per day. The lack of working capital to support the business is the main challenge for her family.

Kan is a very old client, as she has been with VisionFund for twelve cycles. The previous loans have helped her family to have sufficient food, proper clothes and to expand her business. Now, Kan is asking for another loan of US$1,000 to buy a decent motorbike for her son for commuting to the rice field so that he can save time on traveling and spend a longer time at the rice field.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike.

loans.name: Ba's Group

texts.en:
Ba is a farmer who lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 54 years old and married with seven children. She grows cucumbers and leeks to support the family. Having been in this business for twenty years, Ba is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yields resulting from floods is the main challenge for her field business.

Ba has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member is new to VisionFund. The past loans have helped to better support the family by having sufficient food to eat. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, Ba will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. Ba hopes this loan will allow her to make more income through selling good quality crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même famille. La représentante du groupe, Marie dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Marie est mariée à un certain Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Marie mène comme activité la vente des glacières et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Djromahuton is a group of 3 people whose members belong to the same family. The group's representative, Marie (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 45 years old and married to Michel. The couple have 4 dependent children, all of whom attend, or have attended, school. The couple live together with their children and both take care of the different household needs.

Marie did not go to school. She has been selling coolers and kitchen utensils via the distribution system for nearly 4 years. Marie works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Marie is requesting a 4th loan, together with the other members of the Djromahuton group. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy coolers and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Samart is 26 years old and married with two dependent children, both of whom are at school age. Farming rice and selling grocery items are the main sources of the family’s income, which she has been doing for several years. To complement the income, her husband works as a paid car driver. She earns about 33,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 24,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.

Samart is in the second loan cycle with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her to relieve the family’s burden and improve their standard of living. Now she is requesting another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Samart believes that her crops will produce good yields so that she can sell them for a higher price, and hence her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.en:
