Claudia María makes a living selling commodities (adult and children's clothing, shoes and cosmetics). Claudia María is a very hard-working and responsible woman with a drive for self-improvement. She needs financing to make improvements to her home such as changing the roof of her father's room to offer him better living conditions, and the construction of a wall and roof for the kitchen since it is currently a makeshift kitchen.

She has wanted to make these improvements for six years but because of a lack of economic resources, she has not been able to make them, since she has other obligations such as feeding and educating her children and taking care of her father. 

With financing, she will buy construction material such as zinc, cement, nails, sand, blocks and wood. Claudia thanks the Kiva investors for the help they offer people who are disadvantaged and from poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, sand, cement and blocks

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталье 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей  - 7 лет и 1 года. Наталья в качестве основного дохода с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Натальи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова с приплодом, 1 бычок, 7 свиней, ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 3 бычков и 10 поросят для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Наталья планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства на покупку машины для транспортировки мясных и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: Natalya is 28 years old, married and raising two children, who are seven and one years old.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2000, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som.  Thanks to Natalya's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring, one bull and seven pigs, and the monthly income amounts to 5,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Natalya requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy three bulls and ten piglets for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to purchase a car to transport meat and milk products.

loans.use: to buy three bulls and ten piglets for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Maira

texts.es: Maira de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de loroco, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la siembra que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y es muy conocida se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Maira  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, dispuesta a salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, ahora que empieza la temporada de siembra quiere aprovechar para aumentar su producción pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de loroco, insecticida, abono, etc. Maira tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maira, 28, lives with her life companion and their children.  She grows and sells loroco [edible flower producing vine].  She’s been working in agriculture for several years and has gained much experience that makes it possible for her to produce the best harvests.  Her farmland is located in a zone of high agricultural activity very near her house.  She sells all around her location and is very well-known; she’s acquired a large clientele because she’s preferred because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and above all her service is excellent.

Maira is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s energetic and determined to get ahead; she’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will put her on the road to success.  

Now that the planting season is to begin, she wants to increase production but lacks sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy loroco seeds, insecticide, manure, etc.  Maira has good payment references and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that she will be able to provide her home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy loroco seeds, insecticide and manure.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 28, lives with her long-term partner and her two children. She sells charcoal to earn a living.

She has run her business for three months and has already gained a large customer base. People like her because all her products are high quality, the price is reasonable, and the service is good.

Christine is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed. She is always looking for alternative ways to help her achieve success and will not give up until she has reached her goal. Like any good salesperson she wants to grow her business, but she does not have enough capital so she has requested a loan from Yehu to enable her to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

Christine is certain that she will be able to pay off the debt in the established time period and believes that she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru:
Гайбулло житель города Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Гайбулло имеет высшее образование. Он работает бухгалтером. Кроме того Гайбулло занимается животноводством. Он на протяжении трех лет совмещает работу бухгалтера и животноводство. 
Гайбулло разводит скот у себя дома. У него имеется коровник, где он разводит коров и бычков. Гайбулло просит кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Gaybullo is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 30 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Gaybullo has a higher education and works as an accountant.  Besides this work, Gaybullo is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been combining the accounting work and animal husbandry for three years.  Gaybullo breeds livestock at home.  He has a cowshed, where he breeds cows and bulls.  Gaybullo is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Luís Ángel

texts.es:
El Señor Luis tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a  su esposa y 3 hijos (una niña de 3 años y dos varones, uno de 16 años y otro de 9 años respectivamente). Solo los varones están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. Es una persona honorable, en su comunidad es líder pertenece a la estructura de La Asociación de Desarrollo Comunal (ADESCO) y a una asociación a nivel nacional de juntas directivas de agua potable.

Se dedica a trabajar como albañil, actividad que la aprendió cuando tenia 20 años, como consecuencia de trabajar como ayudante de albañil con un amigo, quien le dió confianza y se fue desarrollando en el rubro; también, se dedica al cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz , 17,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de  yuca, estas áreas las cultiva desde hace mas de 10 años; cultiva hortalizas, específicamente 1500 plantas de Chile NATALY y 1500 plantas de  Tomate de mesa,  esta actividad la esta  desarrollando desde hace 5 años, manifiesta que inició en esto debido a que se quedó sin trabajar en construcción por la caída  del sector, por el alza en los precios de los materiales. 

En agosto de 2012 adquirió una maquina desgranadora de maíz, la que se acciona de forma manual y la renta a sus vecinos y amigos agricultores en $20.00 por día o les cobra $1.00 por cada 200 libras que desgranan.

Su esposa es la responsable de administrar el negocio de la renta de sillas plásticas, mesas plásticas y manteles (posee 360 sillas, 40 mesas y 65 manteles)

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en la ciudad, aproximadamente a 12 kilometros , los que recorre en su vehículo pick up , compra los insumos, semillas y plantas de contado. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra  de mas sillas, mesas y manteles, que serán destinados para rentarlos a personas e instituciones que realizan eventos y convivios en la comunidad y sus alrededores.

Consideran que la demanda que poseen es alta y con frecuencia rentan sillas en otros lugares para cubrir esas demandas generando negocio para otros de su competencia. Con esto se espera que sus ingresos familiares mejoren.

Su objetivo es crecer con el negocio y con sus clientes, espera generar los ingresos suficientes que permitan facilitar la educación de sus hijos, para que puedan superarse como profesionales y ayuden a otros de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children (a 3 year-old girl and two boys, one 16 years-old and the other 9 years-old). Only the boys currently attend school in the community. 

Luis is an honorable person. He is a leader in his community and belongs to La Asociación de Desarrollo Comunal (ADESCO) (The Community Development Association) and to a national association of governing boards for potable water.

Luis is a mason, a job he learned at the age of 20 as a result of working as an assistant mason with a friend, who gave him confidence so that he developed in that field. He also farms 7,000 square meters (approx. 1.7 acres) of corn, 17,500 square meters (approx. 4.3 acres) of cassava and has been cultivating these crops for more than ten years; he also grows vegetables, specifically 1,500 NATALY Chile plants and 1,500 table tomato plants. He has been growing these crops for the past five years and states that he began farming because he did not have construction work due to the fall in the sector because of the rise in the price of materials. 

In August, 2012, he acquired a corn shelling machine, one that is manually operated, and rents it to his neighbors and friends, who are farmers, at $20 a day and collects $1.00 from them for every 200 pounds they shell.

Luis’ wife is responsible for administering their business renting plastic chairs and tables and table cloths (she has 360 chairs, 40 tables and 65 table cloths).

He purchases his agricultural supplies in the city, which is approximately 12 kilometers (approx. 7.5 miles) away. He transports them in his pick up truck and he pays cash for the seeds and plants.

The loan will be invested in buying more chairs, tables and table cloths, which will be rented to people and institutions that have events and get-togethers in the community and surrounding areas. They feel there is a high demand as they frequently rent chairs in other places to meet the demand, generating business for the competition. They hope this investment will improve their family income.

Luis’ objective is for his business and customers to grow. He expects to generate sufficient income to enable him to educate his children so they can succeed as professionals and help others in the community.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables and table cloths, which will be rented to individuals and institutions.

loans.name: Medardo Ruben

texts.es: Medardo Rubén de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, los años de trabajo en el rubro le han regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, lo buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Medardo es un hombre amable, honesto muy dedicado a su labor todos los días lucha por ganarse un futuro mejor sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra el éxito que desea; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Medardo Rubén tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Medardo Rubén, 56, lives with his life companion and their children.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn.  The years of work in this field has provided him with valuable experience that makes it possible for him to produce the best harvests.  His farmland is located in an area where agriculture is concentrated near his house.  He sells all around his area and has acquired a large number of regular customers who prefer him because of the quality, good prices and excellent service.  

Medardo is a kind, honest man who is very dedicated to his daily work to earn a better future.  He knows that with all his effort and dedication he will attain the success he desires.

He suffered some losses last harvest and wants to recuperate which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Medardo Rubén has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn's Group

texts.en: Bunthoeurn is 37 years old and is originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two little kids who are underage for schooling. She has managed about one hectare of farmland for growing rice as her main source of income. Besides helping her on the rice field, her husband also catches fish to sell for additional income. Bunthoeurn is able to earn almost 21,000 KHR per day from the current business, which she has been engaged in for 18 years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one cycle already. She has paid back the entire loan, which has relieved her family's burden and upgraded her family's livelihood. Now she has formed a group of three female members to apply for a new loan in the same loan amount, 1,000,000 KHR each. As group leader, she will use her portion to buy a small boat to support her husband's fishing business. She hopes that her husband can catch more fish so as to add more income for their children's sake.

loans.use: To buy a small boat to support her husband's business

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en: Aged 52, Bun is a citizen from Sangke district of Battambang province. She has five children, four of whom are in school. To support the basic daily needs for her family, she grows rice and raises pigs whilst her husband is a paid worker in Thailand. This is a first loan for Bun’s group with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Her group consists of two female members, and she is the group leader. She is applying for 700,000 KHR, and her co-member is requesting 600,000 KHR. As a group leader, Bun will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes to grow healthy crops so as to make more income in order to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: EL grupo solidario Chavarría esta conformado por Juana del Carmen de 48 anos de edad,  casada, con dos hijos de 21,26 y Paula Emilia pertenecen al  departamento de Chinandega que esta ubicado en el occidente del país una zona muy comercial. Juana su actividad económica es la venta de  mercadería en general y pulpería las cuales consisten en vender ropa nueva, calzado, cosméticos, y en la pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se venden productos de consumo diario al por menor como: arroz por libra, aceite por cuarta, una caja de fosforo, cebolla por unidad, una barra de pan. Actividad que la tiene ubicada en su casa y de forma ambulante, Juana  cuenta con 17 anos de experiencia. Su rutina diaria es levantarse a las 5:00 am, para abrir su pulpería desde hora muy temprana para aprovechar y vender ya que sus clientes tienen que levantarse y buscar el desayuno para mandar a sus hijos a clases hasta la 10:00 pm. El negocio lo inicie con ahorros propios de su trabajo como docente en la cual se tuvo  que jubilarse por enfermedad y decidió iniciar su  propio negocio. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y algunos encargos de mis clientes. Y Paula tiene por actividad la venta de refrescos casada, con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente tiene 18 anos de experiencia los refrescos los elabora a base de frutas naturales, leche de vaca, y gracias  a Dios y al calidad de sus frescos es que tienen clientes fijos y eventuales, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en las orillas  del  mercado de la localidad. En la foto observamos a la   Sra Paula ofreciendo sus refresco con un delantal y su termo en la orrilas del mercado.  El grupo solidario  Chavarría agradece  la ayuda que le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Chavarría is made up of Juana del Carmen, who is 48, married, and has two children, aged 21 and 26, and Paula Emilia. They belong to the department of Chinandega, a well-known commercial area, which is located in the west of the country. 

Juana sells general merchandise, which consists of new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, as well as a small shop where she sells goods for daily consumption such as: rice by the pound, quarts of oil, matchbooks, onions, loaves of bread. Juana has 17 years of experience in business activity out of her home and on rounds.

Her daily routine is to get up at 5:00 am to open the shop from a very early hour--to take advantage and sell as her clients have to get up and find breakfast to send their children to class--until 10:00 pm. She started the business with savings from her job as a teacher, from which she had to retire due to illness, and so decided to start her own business.

The objective of this loan is to invest in clothing for women, men and children, and some orders for her clients. 

Paula is married and has six children, all of age and independent. Her business is selling refreshments, and she has 18 years experience. She makes the soft drinks with a natural fruit base and cow's milk. Thanks to God and the quality of her drinks, she has regular and transient clients. The business is located at the edge of the local market. 

In the photo, we see Paula offering her drinks in an apron with her cooler at the edge of the market. 

The solidarity group Chavarría is grateful for the assistance given to small businesses with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of dairy products and general merchandise and natural soft drinks

loans.name: Fevita

texts.en:
Raising hogs is the business of Fevita. She started her livestock business at the age of 33 and continues to this day. According to her, farming has been the primary source of income for her family.

Fevita had one hectare of rice field and two hectares of corn field. Her spouse is in charge of taking care of their farming business. The couple has three children. All of them are married and separately living with them. Fevita has raised one sow so far. She plans to purchase four piglets and livestock feed for their daily maintenance, but the capital intended for her hog-raising business is not enough, so she has asked for a loan of 10,000 PHP. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to have a better way of living and to help her business continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and livestock feed

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very good homemaker who's dedicated to her household, to taking care of her children and to sales. She has been selling clothing and firewood for the last seven years, in addition to owning a food stall. She sells door to door and from home. 

Fatuma is grateful for the loans she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. She says that the previous loan was the stepping stone to opening several businesses. Thanks for helping with her visionary efforts.

She will use this new loan to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of firewood for reselling, since she has orders to deliver. Her dreams are to move forward with her businesses and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of firewood for reselling

loans.name: Teum's Group

texts.en:
Teum, aged 52 and residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, is one of the breadwinners in a family with two children. To strive for a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on their two hectares of farmland for 15 years. 

Her main challenge is the lack of working capital for supporting her crop. Therefore, she has formed a group of three female members to apply for a new first-cycle loan. She and one of her co-members are applying for 100,000 KHR each whilst the remaining member is applying for 200,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that this loan will enable her to boost her yield so that she can make a larger income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en:
A rice farmer originally from the Thmor Kuol district of Cambodia, Leam is 64 years old and has struggled to make a decent income for her household through paddy rice growing. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years. Her main challenge is the fruitless crop yield due to the shortage of a water supply. 

Leam's group is composed of two females, both applying for their first loan with VisionFund. They are requesting 250,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to double her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is 18 years old. She is not married yet and lives with her parents. Her parents' salary is small and that’s why she decided to start a new business sewing women’s dresses. 

She has taken a "to get ahead" course at a women's organization and has learned business skills. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine for establishing her new business. With this loan, her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to establish a new business

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comite Kuña Mbarete se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo, en su barrio son conocidas por su buena onda y por las ganas que tienen de salir adelante.
La señora Nimia es un  ejemplo de perseverancia y del empeño que pone para progresar, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas. Ya tiene una clientela bien definida, pues siempre tiene buenos precios y buena variedad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para poder surtirse con mas variedad de prendas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en: The Kuna Mbarete committee stands out because of its unity and its desire to progress as a group.  Its members are well known in their neighborhood for being cool people and for wanting to get ahead.  Nimia is an example of perseverance and of the determination to progress that she shows.  She says that she works selling all types of clothing.  She has a very loyal customer base, as she always has good prices and good variety.  She is requesting a loan in order to supply herself with a greater variety of clothing items, such as pants, shirts, T-shirts, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas  II ” se encuentra en el Decimo Sexto Ciclo con  19 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Nilda forma parte del grupo, y cuenta que ella vende todo tipo de perfumes. Gracias a sus buenas dotes de vendedora está creciendo y de esa forma ayuda a su familia.  Tiene clientes y clientas que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos y es por ello que le va muy bien. Solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con más variedad de fragancias y así seguir con lo que está haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee is named "Mujeres Unidas II" and is in its sixteenth cycle with 19 members, each with her respective business. They are quite close, responsible and mutually supportive of one other. 

Nilda makes up part of the group and says that she sells all kinds of perfumes. Thanks to her good talent for selling she is growing and in this way helps her family. She has male and female customers who are always ordering a lot from her and that's why it's going very well for her. She is seeking the loan to be able to stock up with a greater variety of fragrances and so keep on with what she is doing.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hard working mother who raises hogs to help her husband generate income. They live in a village, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. These hogs, rice, and vegetables are the family's major sources of income, and they aim to improve their poor living condition so they can give their children a bright future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, Perlita and her husband are determined to achieve their goals.

Perlita's plan is to raise and sell more pigs, but she does not have enough money to start. So, she is asking for an additional of 45,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, along with feed, vitamins, and vaccines. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business, allowing her to make it viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets plus feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, a rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province in the Philippines, is a 54-year-old mother of nine children. Two out of her nine children are studying in a local primary school. She provides daily sustenance for her family by growing rice on one hectare of farmland. She also owns a vegetable garden for growing various vegetables and mints. Her husband contributes income by operating a small tire-patching stall. 

Having farmed for 30 years, Oun is able to earn about 14,000 KHR ($3.45 USD) per day. For her, the big challenge is insufficient working capital to support business expenses, especially fertilizer and plowing fees. Therefore, Oun has formed a two-person loan group. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow her cash-crop on time and to make a good profit, so she can create a secure standard living in her household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es: Oscar Alfonso de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite  obtener las mejore cosechas,  el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona apta para el cultivo, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y es muy conocido pues se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues las personas lo buscan por la buena calidad, buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Oscar es un hombre entregado a su labor y a su familia, siempre esta buscando las mejores oportunidades que le abran paso al éxito, en la ultima cosecha tuvo perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, abono, insecticida etc. Oscar Alfonso tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Oscar Alfonso is 45 years old and lives together with his spouse and their children. He works growing corn, beans, and millet and his many years working in agriculture have given him the experience necessary to obtain the best crops. His land is in a prime location for cultivation, he sells in all the local markets, and he is well known for being kind and honest. He has many established customers who seek him out because he offers good quality, good prices, and, above all else, excellent customer service. Oscar is a dedicated worker and family man. He is always looking for the best opportunities that will bring him success, so after suffering losses to his last crop he hoped to recover by applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will help him to purchase seed for corn, beans, millet, compost, and insecticide, etc. Oscar Alfonso has good payment references, he is responsible, and he ensures that he will be able to pay while at the same time bringing economic security to his home.

loans.use: to purchase seed for corn, beans, millet, compost, and insecticide.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de la Fundación Paraguaya, cuenta con 15 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas.
Estela por ejemplo vende todo tipo de frutas y de esa forma honestamente se gana la vida. Su deseo es poder seguir con lo que hace y así inculcarle a su familia que con el trabajo duro se logra lo que se quiere.
Estela solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de todo tipo y así seguir con su trabajo que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) is in the third cycle of the Fundación Paraguaya program. It has 15 members from the Asuncion area; all the members and engaged in productive activities.

For example, Estela sells all types of fruit, and makes an honest living this way. She wants to be able to continue with what she does, in this way instilling in her family that with had work, one can get what one wants.

Estela is requesting a loan to buy all types of fruit and continue her work which is her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas cuenta con trece integrantes en donde todas trabajan arduamente y como el grupo dice, son muy unidas y responsables. Todas tienen como meta superar la pobreza y darle a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
Una miembro muy trabajadora es Sonia, que se dedica a la costura, ella tiene su tallercito donde hace todos los pedidos que tiene y de esa forma ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día. Comenta que siempre tiene mucha clientela y eso es muy bueno porque la ayudan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder hacer y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Mujeres Unidas has thirteen members, all of whom work hard and, as the group says, are very united and responsible.  They all have as their goal to overcome poverty and give their families all that they need for a worthy and decent life.  One very hard-working member is Sonia, who works doing sewing.  She has a small workshop where she makes all of the orders that she receives, and in this way helps her family with their day to day expenses.  She says that she always has many customers and that this is good because they help her.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies in order to complete the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José Ángel de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, los años de trabajo en el rubro le han regalado mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a la localidad donde vive, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas a la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; José es un hombre emprendedor, enérgico, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima cosecha aumento la demanda  y quiere aumentar  la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, abono, etc. José Ángel tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Ángel, 39, lives with his life companion and their children in his own house.  He grows corn, sorghum and beans.  The years he’s worked have given him much valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best harvests.  His farmland is located in an area of high agricultural concentration very near where he lives.  He sells all around his area and has secured a large clientele that prefers him because he always has what they need: top quality products at affordable prices in addition to good service.

José is an enterprising, energetic person who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will help him reach success.  Demand increased last harvest and he wants to increase production but lacks sufficient capital to do so which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to José Ángel buy corn, bean and sorghum seeds, manure, etc.  José Ángel has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, bean and sorghum seeds and manure.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
Korn is 34 years old and a resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children to care for. Some of her children are in school, some are still young, and one son helps with the family's business. Korn has tackled her family's need for decent food by cultivating rice on two hectares of farmland. Her husband helps in the rice field, and in his spare time he labors for others to earn money. With 10 years' experience in this business, Korn is able to earn about 24,000 KHR (approximately $5.92 USD) per day. However, she has achieved limited rice production so far this season because the water supply is low. 

Korn's loan group consists of she and another female member, and both are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Korn is the group leader and is applying for a 500,000 KHR loan; her co-member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. Korn will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for the rice farm and to pay labor costs. She hopes to produce a better yield so she can get a good price and sustain her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs for her rice farm.

loans.name: Misael Alexander

texts.es: Misael Alexander de veintiuno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus padres; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia  valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra y muy cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque posee todo lo que desean, con producto de calidad, buenos precios pero sobre todo con un buen servicio; Misael es un hombre emprendedor con muchas metas que desea alcanzar  todos los días tiene la esperanza que con este esfuerzo puede ganarse un futuro mejor , no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito; en esta temporada de siembra quieren aumentar la producción por es le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol abono, herramienta, etc. Misael Alexander tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Misael Alexander, 21, lives with his life companion and his parents.  He grows corn.  The years he’s worked have given him much valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best harvests.  His farmland is located in an area of high agricultural concentration very near where he lives.  He sells all around his area and has secured a large clientele that prefers him because he always has what they need: top quality products at affordable prices in addition to good service.

Misael is an enterprising man with many goals to reach.  Every day he has the hope that through his efforts he will be able to secure a better future; he does not plan to give up until he does so.  This planting season Misael wants to increase production which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, tools, etc.    Misael has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide his family with fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, manure and tools.

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es: Dimas Antonio de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente el cultivo de maíz y frijol,  los veinte años de trabajo en el rubro le han regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños a la localidad, tiene mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, la calidad y el buen servicio; Dimas es un hombre luchador, entregado a su trabajo todos los días se levanta con la ilusión que con su esfuerzo y  motivación alcanzara el éxito, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, abono, insecticida, etc. Dimas Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dimas Antonio, 40, lives with his life companion and their children.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  The twenty years he’s worked have given him much valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best harvests.  His farmland is located in an area of high agricultural concentration very near where he lives.  He sells all around his area and has secured a large clientele that prefers him because he always has what they need: top quality products at affordable prices in addition to good service.

Dimas is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He rises every day with the hope that through his efforts and motivation he will reach success.  This planting season he wants to increase production but needs capital to do so which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn, bean and sorghum seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.    Dimas has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and sorghum seeds, manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of charcoal to stock her store.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry is a 48-year-old mother of four kids, one of whom is still in school. She helps her family survive by growing rice with her husband. The six hectares of rice-cropping farm they cultivate has been her sole source of income for 24 years. To maintain good progress on her farm, she is joining with another second-time borrower to apply for a new group loan. Ry used her first loan with success to maintain her family's livelihood and business. Now, she and her co-borrower are requesting 1,200,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and gasoline to power water pumps for her rice field. She hopes to make more income from her current business and to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and gasoline to fuel water pumps for her rice field

loans.name: Arte De Proyectar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Arte de Proyectar” está conformado por 22 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; masajes, venta de volantines, venta de inciensos y velas, venta de tortas, venta de perfume, venta de pantalones, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Maria integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color rojo, usa un pañuelo alrededor de su cuello, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa corto, en sus manos sostiene unos papeles.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, verdulería y florería, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que su negocio lo ubica en un local en centro de la ciudad de Chillan, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 8ºº hasta las 17ºº horas.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de chillan en diferentes supermercados, y tambien en las feria a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará longaniza, pollo, zanahoria, ajo, lechugas, flores artificiales, adornos.
Una de las metas de Maria en su negocio, son agrandar su negocio, tener de todo para su clientela, ya que en su bazar tiene hasta ropa, todas las verduras que uno encuentra en la feria y todo tipo de arreglos florales,  es el único de los negocios que se dedica a vender flores.
Maria vive junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad, su nuera y su nieta de 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es ampliar su negocio así con esto ayudar a su hijo, ya que sabe lo difícil que es salir a delante. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Arte de Proyectar” is made up of 22 entrepreneurs who are involved in a variety of business activities.  These include the sale of kites, incense and candles, cakes, perfume, clothing, a massage business and other types of service-oriented businesses.  The members are all from the city of Chillán.

Maria is a member of the communal bank. In the photo she is standing fourth from the left side in the first row behind the chairs.  She is wearing a red jacket and has a scarf around her neck.  Her hair is dark and short, and she is holding some papers in her hands.

For the last two years she has sold meat, vegetables and flowers and other items in the local market.  She reports that her business is located in a central area of the city of Chillán.  She works seven days a week from 8 am to 5 pm.

She buys her merchandise in various supermarkets and outdoor markets in Chillán at low cost, as this is economical.  With the loan proceeds she will buy sausage, chicken, carrots, garlic, lettuce, artificial flowers and decorative items.

One of her goals is to expand her business and to attract all sorts of customers.  She sells everything from clothing to almost every type of vegetable to all types of floral arrangements, whether for a gift or a funeral.   Hers is the only business in the marketplace that sells flowers.

Maria lives with her 28-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her 5-year-old granddaughter.  She dreams of expanding her business and being able to help her son, since she knows how difficult it is to get ahead.

She is very grateful for this loan opportunity brought to her by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business.  With respect to the communal bank to which she belongs, she says that there is very good communication within the group.  Additionally, there are training sessions that have helped her learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Chillán is a community in the south of Chile.  This name means "seat of the sun" in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as "Cradle of the Homeland" or "Land of Artists", owing to the fact that many distinguished individuals in Chilean history have been born there, for example the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy sausage, chicken, carrots, garlic, lettuce, artificial flowers and decorative items.

loans.name: Renacer Ii Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Renacer II” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de joyas, artesanía, sopaipillas, empanadas, venta de papas fritas, venta de hilos y agujas, mueblería, venta de mermeladas, venta de condimentos, cosmetología, podología, banqueteria a domicilio,, tejido, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Curicó.
Liliana secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en el centro del grupo del Banco Comunal, viste una chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro lo usa largo y suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa de casa como manteles, toallas, sabanas, cortina, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que también se desempeña trabajando en cocinería preparando almuerzos a una constructora, trabaja desde su casa de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Su venta de ropa la realiza a gente conocida como familiares o a través de internet.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para la venta de  ropa, la compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Liliana es tener un puesto establecido para la venta de ropa, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Liliana vive junto a su esposo, su madre y 2 hijas de 12 y 5 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia, y a nivel laboral es tener su negocio, ya que con los ingresos puede darle estudios a sus hijas y un buen pasar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte se siente cómoda, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Rebirth II" and consists of 17 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different areas of sales, among which are the selling of jewelry, crafts, buns, pies, fries, yarns and needles, furniture, jams, condiments, cosmetology, podiatry, as well as an in-home banquet, knitting, and other services. All group members live in the city of Curico.

Liliana is the secretary of the Communal Bank, and in the picture she is standing in the center of the group wearing a dark colored jacket.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears it long and loose.  She has been dedicated for the past two years to selling clothing and fabrics for home use such as tablecloths, towels, sheets, and curtains.  She notes that she also works in food service preparing meals for a builder.  She works from home Monday to Friday and her schedule is determined based on availability. Her clothing sales are made to people that she knows or to family members or via internet.  

The goods and supplies that she needs for her different jobs she acquires in the city of Santiago, and she purchases food for the preparation of her lunches in different supermarkets at low cost.  It is thus economically convenient.  With the credit she will buy bundles of clothes.  One of Liliana's goals is to have an established stall for selling her clothing products, and with that generate more income and find a better quality of life.  

Liliana lives with her husband, her mother, and two daughters aged 12 and 5 who are in school.  Her dream for the family is to have their own home,  and her dream for work is to have her own successful business, since with the income she would be able to give her children a good quality of life.  

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, since it permits others to invest in her business. She says that the trainings offered have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development, since she has learned to organize and distribute in a more effective way her income and investments.  With respect to her group she feels comfortable, which motivates her to keep participating.

Curicó is located in the Maule region, in the central zone of the country. Curico's climate is Mediterranean and is considered one of the nicest in the country. It is also characterized by its culture centered on wine and surrounding natural beauty. Although the labor force has increased, this area remains, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: Comprará fardos de ropa para abastecer su negocio

loans.name: Kennelis Feliciana

texts.es: Kennelis Feliciana de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su con su compañero de vida y su hijo; ella se dedica al cultivo de frijol y maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola muy accesible, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precio accesible y con excelente servicio; Kennelis es una mujer emprendedora, activa, y con muchos sueños que desea alcanzar, día a día trabaja al máximo pues sabe que solo así en un futuro cercano alcanzara el éxito, en esta época de cosecha quiere realizar una nueva inversión y producir pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de frijol, insecticida, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Kennelis Feliciana tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica y mejor calidad de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Kennelis Feliciana, 27, lives with her life companion and their son.  She works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  She has several years’ experience working and has acquired much valuable experience that makes it possible for her to obtain the best harvests.  Her farmland is located in a very accessible area of high agricultural concentration.  She sells all around her area and has secured a large clientele that prefers her because she always has what they need: top quality products at affordable prices in addition to good service.

Kennelis is an enterprising, active woman who has many dreams to reach.  She works hard every day because she knows this is the only way to attain success in the near future.  This planting season she wants to make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy bean seeds, manure, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.    Kennelis Feliciana has good payment references and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide her home with economic security and her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, manure and tools.

loans.name: Manduvira Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes del grupo Manduvira son de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma crecer en la actividad que cada una hace.
 Apolinaria es una persona visionaria, y ve una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y es gracias a este trabajo que está saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans y demás tipo, y así seguir dando buena calidad a sus clientes. agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de Kiva y fundación
texts.en:
The 13 members of the Manduvira group are from the city of Caacupé. They joined together with the goal of helping each other so that they can all grow in their businesses.
Apolinaria is a visionary. She sees a great opportunity to progress through the female entrepreneurs' program at the Fundacion. She sells all kinds of clothing garments. Thanks to this work, she is getting ahead.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of all kinds of clothing garments, such as T-shirts, shirts, and jeans. This will allow her to continue providing good quality to her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity from Kiva and the Fundacion.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El comite Rosa Mistica es de la zona de San Lorenzo son 14 integrantes  muy responzables. Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reunen siempre para resolver cualquier problemita del grupo y ayudan a su comunidad siempre.
Anastasia es costurera y dice que siempre tiene mucho trabajo, es gracias a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos que ha podido crecer y es por ello que sus clientes siempre vuelven a ella. Cuenta que su meta es seguir trabajando y superar cualquier desafío que pueda aparecer.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, gomas y botones, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Mística Communal Bank, from the San Lorenzo area, is made up of 12 very responsible members.  All of them are very responsible and hardworking mothers who always get together to resolve whatever problem and always help their community.

Anastasia is a seamstress, and she says she always has a lot of work.  It's because she always does very good work that she has been able to grow and her customers always come back.  She says her goal is to continue working and to overcome any challenge that might come up.

She's requesting the loan to buy fabric, elastic, and buttons, with which she'll be able to continue working and fulfilling her commitments to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Tobati Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes del grupo mujeres unidas de Tobati, son de Caacupé, ellas son muy emprendedoras y han visto una gran oportunidad de progresos para ellas y sus familias.
Reina es la presidenta y una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica al comercio y cuenta que tiene una surtida despensa con los artículos de primera necesidad que necesitan sus vecinos. Gracias a este trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su negocio con bebidas, gaseosas, lácteos, panificados y demás, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y dando lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the Mujeres Unidas de Tobati (United Women of Tobati) Group are from Caacupé. They are very entrepreneurial and they have seen a great opportunity for progress for themselves and their families. 

Reina is the president and one of the members of the group. She makes a living as a vendor and she has a pantry stocked with convenience store items that her neighbors need. Thanks to this work she gives her family what they need to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to be able to be able to supply her business with beverages, sodas, dairy products, baked goods and more, with which she will be able to continue working and giving the best to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sodas, dairy products, baked goods and more

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Khun is a mother of eight children, three of whom are still in school. The rest of her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To overcome the family's hardship, Khun has been growing rice on five hectares of farmland for 30 years. Her main challenge is the drought which lowers her crop production. 

Khun's group consists of two female members. She and her fellow group member are in the second loan cycle. The past loan, which she has paid back, has made a better living for her family especially in keeping her children in school. For this new loan, she is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR, the same amount as her co-member. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that there will be enough rainfall in order to support her yield so she can have a larger output and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, & insecticide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 57 years old, married, and has four grown-up children. They live in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. Due to the hardships of living, some of her children did not pursue their studies in college. Despite these things, they helped each other in cultivating their farm to ensure high production. Rosalinda also works in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to earn and save more income to start another business for her children to manage someday. She is asking for a loan of PHP 26,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through hard work, she will improve her business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is 24 years old. She and her common-law husband have three children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband works as a businessman. They rent the house where they live.

Umazi has been an entrepreneur for three years; specifically, she operates a food-vending business by selling at the market. She started this type of work in order to contribute to her household income and to help her family get ahead in life. She hopes to improve her business soon.

She appreciates Yehu because its loans give her the chance to grow her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, beans, and rice.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing various food products (e.g., cooking oil, wheat flour, beans, and rice).

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun is a 59-year-old man residing in the Pursat province’s Bakan district of Cambodia. He is married and blessed with two lovely children (one daughter and one son), both of whom are currently in school.

Sun supports his family through his rice-farming business, which he has been involved in for thirty years. He earns approximately 15,000 KHR per day and, after deducting daily expenses, saves approximately 5,000 KHR per day.

Sun is leading a group of two individuals, both of whom are first-cycle clients with VisionFund (a Kiva partner), to request a loan. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR, and his fellow group member's requested loan is in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR. With his portion of the loan proceeds, he would like to buy insecticide and fertilizers and to pay fees to plow his rice field. He hopes that this loan will assist him in improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To improve his rice-farming business by purchasing insecticide and fertilizers and by paying for plowing services

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts for machines

loans.name: Nigandi

texts.en:
Nigandi is a fish monger living in Likoni, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. 

Fish is among the staple food among the residents of Likoni. She has been operating the business for five years. Nigandi started from a limited stock of fish and has seen her capital grow with time. In this business she sells fried fish. The challenge currently is high cost of transport, since she has to go upcountry for the type of fish she sells.

Nigandi joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 11,350 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of fish. Her ambition is to be the largest supplier of fish to the areas around Likoni town.

The extra income will also form part of Nigandi’s future savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish, charcoal, and fat.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
28-year old Dzine lives in her own house. She has three children who live with her. Dzine runs a store selling household products. She works every day from 7 am to 9pm. Most of her income comes from the store so she is looking for ways to keep it well-stocked.

Dzine is seeking a loan to buy flour, rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, juice, and snacks which will enable her to fully stock her store with all the items that her customers ask for. The loan will provide her with working capital so she can continue to make many sales and earn a good income.

Her objective is to keep her store running well and do whatever is necessary to continue working.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, juice, and snacks

loans.name: Orng's Group

texts.en:
Orng, aged 57, is a mother of seven children--one of whom is still dependent on her and in school. Her family's core business is rice-farming on five hectares of farmland; it is the only business that she has been involved in for 35 years.

The main challenge for this business is the lack of rainfall which reduces her output. Orng and her co-member are new to VisionFund (A Kiva partner). She and her co-member are requesting for the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Orng will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her rice field. A portion of it will also be used to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to gain high yield so as to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 38 year old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a laborer. They have three children ages 3, 5, and 6. She supports their needs by operating a Sari-sari store (small convenience store). This business has been in existence for 10 years now. 

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, and snack food and to renovate her house. She hopes that someday she can send all her children to school. Her profit will be used for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, and snack food

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca. She previously accessed a 31,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of some grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Francisca hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for some grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is single and lives in the city of Mombasa. She says that she has a well-equipped hair salon, which has enabled her to get ahead in life and help her parents with their household expenses.

She says that she has been in this business for three years and has plenty of experience. Thanks to her hair salon, she is able to cover her expenses.

Mwanakame tells us that she always has a lot of work, which earns her a good income. She would like to continue in growing her business so that some day she can become a great hairdresser.

Mwanakame is requesting this loan to buy a hair dryer so that she can continue growing her business and move forward.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Rita Antonia

texts.es: Rita Antonia de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal por catalogo, cremas, lociones, cosméticos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante por todos los alrededores de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Rita es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de oportunidades que le ayuden a conseguir sus sueños, quiere ganarse un futuro mas prospero y esta dispuesto a esforzarse hasta tener éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y eso la impulso a realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, lociones, cosméticos, etc. Rita Antonia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura poder cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza de ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Rita Antonia is 48 years old and lives with her three children. She sells personal use products through catalogs such as crèmes, lotions, cosmetics, and other items. Rita has been in business for several years and has gained much experience in making sales. She sells as a traveling merchant in all of the neighborhoods within her district. Rita has many customers who prefer the quality of her products, the good prices that she offers, and the excellent service that she provides. She is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has the drive to succeed. Rita always expects that there will be opportunities that will help her pursue her dreams. She wants to have a more prosperous future, so she is willing to work hard in order to be successful.

Demand has increased within the past few weeks, so Rita is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in the purchase of crèmes, lotions, cosmetics, and other items. She has good payment references and impeccable character. Rita says that she will repay her debt according to the established terms and hopes to provide her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, lotions, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Abrahan

texts.es: José  Abrahan vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y hotalizas, tomate, cebolla entre otros tiene varios años de trabjar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una de zona de incidencia agrícola, comercia a en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precio accesible, y con un servicio excelente; Jose es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, dia a dia lucha por un futuro mejor lleno de mucho éxito, en la temporada pasada  tuvo perdidas con el cultivo y quiere recuperarse por eso eso le solicia a INTEGRAL un credito que le permie comprar semilla de maiz,tomate, cebolla, abono, herbicida, etc. José Abrahán tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, y a la vez tiene fe que llevara seguridad económica y una familiar.
texts.en:
José Abrahan lives with his life-partner and their children. He works growing corn and vegetables like tomatoes and onions, among others. He has worked in agriculture for several years, which has given him plenty of experience that allows him to harvest the best crops. The cropland is located in an agricultural catchment. He trades all over the community, and has gained a lot of clients because everything he sells is of top quality, at an affordable price, and with excellent service. José is an entrepreneurial man, eager to get ahead, fighting daily for a better future filled with success.

In the last season, he had losses with the crops and wants to recover, which is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow him to buy corn, tomato and onion seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. José Abrahán has good references of payment assuring that he can pay off the debt. At the same time, he has faith that it will bring economic and family security.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomato and onion seeds, fertilizer, herbicide

loans.name: Ma's Group

texts.en:
Ma, 57, is a villager who lives in a rural area of Bakan district located in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has eight children, one of whom is employed as a paid worker. To make a living, she works as a farmer who raises eight cows and farms rice. Through this business, she earns approximately 15,000KHR per day. 

Ma, the group leader, and Sokhom are requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000KHR and 1,500,000KHR respectively. For both of them, this will be their first loan with VisionFund. With her loan portion, Ma will buy one more cow to raise in order to supplement her income and guarantee food security for her family. Her only hope for the future is to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and one more cow

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu, age 37, is a very responsible divorced person who works hard to give her five children the best. She has a small cafe at the market area. Since she has already had this business for three years, she has a large base of customers who come to her cafe. They consider her to be a very trustworthy person who takes all the quality standards into account in her food preparation.

Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan with which she wants to increase her sales. She hopes to buy beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and all of the necessary ingredients for making the food she sells. She hopes to increase her sales, provide a better food service to her clients, and obtain new clients to generate extra income.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is a 33-year-old married woman with two sons. They live in a Bilasuvar IDP settlement. Kamala has been breeding cattle for more than 10 years. She receives approximately 40 AZN of monthly financial support from the government, but such support is not enough to cover her family's needs.

To earn a living, Kamala grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells her crops in the central bazaar. Her son helps her with the business. Her monthly income is approximately 100 AZN. She explains that her business is the main source of income for her family.

People use fresh vegetables on a daily basis because many national dishes (such as pilau and dolma) are made of vegetables. Fresh fruit is served at every table in Azerbaijan and is also used for making fresh drinks.

She wants to expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions. As a result, she applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to purchase new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers. This would be her second loan and she has good record of repaying loans.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 23-year-old married woman with one daughter. She is IDP.

To earn a living, Saida breeds cattle for meat sales. She also has two cows for milking purposes. She generates income by selling cattle, fresh yogurt, and milk. Her husband helps her to run the business. Saida usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then re-sells them for a profit from her house. Her monthly income is approximately 800 AZN, and she notes that this business is her family's only source of income.

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, because people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Saida would like to capitalize on such demand by applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy two cattle and animal feed.

loans.use: to satisfy demand by purchasing two additional cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is a 44-year-old married woman. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer who grows seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has seven years of experience in this field, which makes her experienced and skilled. 

Elza usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on most families' tables in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Raising crops requires a lot of strength, which is why her husband helps. 

Elza needs additional capital to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is a 40-year-old young man who is very hardworking and friendly. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with his two daughters and wife in an IDP settlement. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden. He has 10 years of experience in this field. With the help of AqroInvest, he was able to start his business.

Vaqif usually sells his crops from his yard. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on many families' tables in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. He primarily raises grapes, pears, apples, peaches and plums as well as tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and carrots. His monthly income is 90 AZN.

Vaqif has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to increase his income.

loans.name: Vivian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vivian, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ambos trabajan en el hogar, ella tiene el negocio de la venta de pupusas, surgió por el apoyo de una amiga, no tiene un horario establecido para trabajar, su experiencia le permite mantener un buen nivel de clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como el maíz, repollo, gas, aceite, bebidas, esta compra le permite tener lo necesario en el negocio para continuar produciendo pupusas, de esta manera lograra atender de mejor forma a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener una casa propia con su esposo, crecer en el negocio, crecer en su familia, continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Vivian lives with her husband, but they have no children. Both of them work from home. Vivian has a business selling “pupusas”, which she started with the help of a friend. She does not work according to a set schedule. Her experience has enabled her to maintain a steady number of customers.

Vivian is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as corn, cabbage, gas, oil, and beverages. These purchases will enable her to have what she needs for her business so that she can continue making “pupusas”. As a result, she will be able to provide better service to her customers. She aspires to own a house with her husband, grow her business, start a family, and continue working.

loans.use: to buy corn, cabbage, gas, oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives together with the husband, who is a farmer, and 8 dependents in Asebu near Cape Coast, Mary sells fried fish and gari, which she has done for 10 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Mary will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.  She will also buy bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish and grai to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia has been selling secondhand ladies' and children's dresses for four years now. Felicia's husband works with a press, and she uses her income to support him in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Felicia needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothing to sell; she plans to expand her business with the resulting new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, aged 47, is married and lives in Kakata. She has four children between four and 25. Three of the children live with her and attend school, while the oldest one is independent. For the past twelve years, Martha has been operating a pharmacy in her community.
