Luis cuando se quedó sin empleo, tuvo la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio para poder seguir generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para brindar a su familia el sostenimiento necesario; fue así como montó una venta de productos de uso personal la cual tiene hace pocos años pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido sacarla adelante y con esta ha generado los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 14, 15 y 17 años de edad. Buscando diversificar sus ventas y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que están demandando, Luis busca un préstamo para comprar computadores y comenzar a ofrecer el servicio de cibercafé en su negocio.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan, y también sacar su familia adelante ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
When Luis found himself without a job, he took the opportunity to start his own business to be able to continue generating the income that that he needs in his household to provide his family with the necessities of life. That's how he started a personal products shop. He has had his shop for only a few years, but thanks to his efforts, he has been able to keep it going and generate the income he needs to cover the expenses of the home where he lives with his wife and their three children, who are 14, 15, and 17 years old. 

Seeking to diversify his sales and offer his customers what they are asking for, Luis is looking for a loan to buy computers and begin offering a cybercafé service in his business.

His dream is to be able to have a large business where he can create jobs for the people who need them most, and also to support his family, offering them a better quality of life and better economic opportunities so they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy computers and begin offering a cybercafé service in his shop.

loans.name: Melvi

texts.es: Doña Melvi tiene 62 años de edad, soltera, sus hijos son independientes, y vive con una sobrina en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Doña Melvi decidió realizar su propia actividad de negocio después de haber terminado su empleo en una empresa privada. hace dos años que vende refrescos y (topogigios: son helados hechos de leche o frutas envasados en bolsa plástica, este producto lo lleva a vender a otras aldeas cercanas a su comunidad todos los días. es un producto que tiene bastante demanda. Ella lleva tres ciclos de préstamos con ODEF, el actual que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como refrescos y leche para su negocio. Así incrementara sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es ahorrar para atender cualquier imprevisto.
texts.en: Melvi, 62, is single and her children are all independent now.  She lives with her niece in Olanchito, Yoro.  Melvi decided to start her own business when she retired from work in a private firm.  For the last two years she’s been selling soft-drinks and topogigios (frozen treats made with milk or fruit served in plastic bags); she sells them every day in villages adjacent to her community.  This is a product that’s in very high demand.  She’s had three loan cycles with ODEF.  Her current one is for 6,000 Lempiras that she’s going to use to buy ingredients like soft-drinks and milk for her business to increase sales and income.  Her goal is to save up to be able to respond to any unforeseen eventuality.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and milk.

loans.name: Elbegdorj

texts.en: Mr. Elbegdorj, 46, earns a living by driving a taxi in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business two years ago with his old car and serves about 13-16 people a day. This is his family's main source of income. He lives with his wife and children in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. The roof of his house is in bad condition and has been damaged for a long time. He has repaired it many times, but unfortunately it is broken again. In the winter, there is too much heat loss through the bad roof. He uses a coal-fired furnace to get his house warm and keep it that way. But coal-fired furnaces are one of the main reasons for air pollution in Mongolian cities and all around the world. He has decided to replace his roof and is applying for this loan to make that repair possible.

loans.use: to repair his roof.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Erdene, 34, is a mechanical engineer who has worked for a drilling company since 2011. He lives with his wife, three children and parents in a small house which was built many years ago. He is requesting a loan to complete building a new family home beside old one. It will be more spacious and warmer than current one, in part because he is planning to insulate the walls. This will mean that he can use his coal-fired furnace less often. He is requesting this loan to buy building materials such as foam, rock wool and cement.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a new house.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La socia es la señora Felicitas, ella tiene 65 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos adultos, la socia se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como Gallinas y cuyes, los cuales distribuye en los mercados de su provincia, Felicitas realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le proporciona los medios económicos para vivir. Felicitas en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, poder ahorrar y espera que en poco tiempo pueda comprar un puesto en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco y de esta manera hacer crecer su actividad. La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” del distrito de San Salvador de la  provincia de Calca en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 65, is married and has five adult children.  She raises small farm animals like chickens and guinea pigs to sell in her local provincial markets.  Felicitas has been doing this for many years and has been able to raise her family this way; it now is her source of living income.

On this occasion, Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her stay in business.  Now she will be able to save and hopefully in a short period of time set up a stand in one of Cusco’s markets and thus make her business grow.  

She commits to make her installment payments punctually.  Felicitas is a member of the “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” communal bank in San Salvador District in Calca Province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chicks.

loans.name: Mirna Noemy

texts.es:
Mirna, se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante vive junto a su esposo y tiene  un hijo, Ella sale a vender ropa interior y blusas, de forma ambulante en los municipios cercanos mas que todo en zonas donde los pobladores reciben ayuda del gobierno. Solicita un prestamo para invertir el dinero en la compra en la de camisas, ropa interior, calcetines, entre otros.
Mediante el crédito Mirna podría comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y a bajo precio, el riesgo del crédito es que el cliente da la ropa al crédito y muchas veces los clientes no le pagan, el sueño de ella es mejorar su casa con servicios como ponerle ladrillo al piso, agua potable, tambien ayudar a su hijo a estudiar, mantener su negocio por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Mirna sells clothes from place to place; she lives with her husband and she has a son.  She goes out to sell underwear and blouses from place to place in nearby towns, especially in areas where residents get government help.  She’s requesting a loan to invest the money in the purchase of shirts, underwear and socks, among others.

By means of the loan, Mirna will be able to buy larger amounts of clothes at a low price.  The risk with the loan is that she sells on credit and often customers don’t pay her.  Her dream is to make improvements to her house with services like installing a brick floor and potable water, to help her son with his schooling and to stay in business for a long time.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear and socks.

loans.name: Oyundari

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyundari, 37, makes the Mongolian national furniture and appliances at home with her husband. As she said, it is a very fruitful business for her family. They started this business in 1995. 

In the past, they had so many permanent customers and gained a lot of experience. She sells her manufactured furniture in the outdoor bazaar, and some of the furniture is made on requisition. 

Now she needs some funding to supply the raw materials for making the furniture, such as the wood plates, balks (timber), etc. It is necessary to run their business nonstop and expand their sales volume. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the raw materials for wooden furniture manufacturing.

loans.use: to pay for the raw materials for wooden furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Mr. Bayaraa, 35, is an electrician and he has been doing this job since 2003 nonstop. He lives with his wife and his two children in her old house, which is located in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. They live in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

His house has some problems such as heat loss and damage to its roof, inside walls, etc. So he is planning to make repairs and insulation using rock wool, cement, and foam. As he thinks, his home will be warmer after the wall, roof insulation, and a new smart furnace are installed. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution.

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems, and to buy the cars that run on natural gas. The loan Bayaraa is taking will used to buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.use: to buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Uranchimeg, 34, is a cook. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. In the winter, her house becomes very cold because it is old and poorly insulated. She uses a coal-fired stove to warm her home, but it does not work well. That is why she wants to install a water hot-water line to her house. It works better and is less harmful than a coal-fired stove. She is requesting this loan to cover the cost of building materials and to hire workers to install the water-heating line to her house.

loans.use: to install a new heating system in her house.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 43 years old, married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver and she helps supports her family with the income she earns from selling garlic and onions. She began this business a year ago and is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and buy good-quality onions and garlic. This loan will allow her to increase her stock and her sales. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality onions and garlic to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janeth Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  La socia Janeth tiene 49 años de edad ,03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de repostería,la socia elabora tortas, bocaditos, comida, buffets entre otros,la socia trabaja a pedido de forma independiente, la socia trabaja para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios como matrimonios,bautizos cumpleaños,fiestas de 15 años entre otros, la socia a la vez es consejera social ella viaja a distintos lugares para realizar su trabajo siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra insumos como harina, huevos, leche entre otros.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Janeth, 49, is a member off the “Pachamama” communal bank.  She’s married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a pastry business.  She makes cakes, snacks, food and buffets, among others.  She works independently and based on prior order.  She’s contracted to work various events like weddings, baptisms, birthdays, ‘quinceañera’ parties, among others.  She’s also a social counselor and travels to various places to do her work; this is how she supports her family.  She’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, eggs and milk, among others.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, eggs and milk, among others.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de pan,la socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de pan 10 años,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar pan como harina,manteca y azucar.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues with her business baking bread.  She sells in the market from 8am until 6pm.  She’s been in the bread selling business for ten years and she wants to support her children by means of this business.  She requests the loan to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour, shortening and sugar.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour, shortening and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, manioc, bananas, potatoes and meat.

loans.name: Yoen's Group

texts.en:
A rural farmer living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Yoen is aged 54 years and married with six children, three of whom are dependent on her and some of whom are still in school. Yoen has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for ten years and her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a paid taxi driver in the local area. Yoen and her husband can earn approximately 13,000 KHR per day and are able to save about 8,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Lack of water supply is still the main challenge for her agribusiness.

Yoen’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is in her fourth microloan with VisionFund. The past three loans have helped her to support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. Yoen, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her business to grow various kinds of fruits such as mangos, cashews, etc. in order to generate extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville South with her husband and four children, who range in age from four to 13 years old. All of her children live at home and attend school. In 2010, she went into the business of selling dry goods (rice, oil, and other items) on a table in the local market. Her main challenge is taking care of her children, and she is happy to have learned this business from her parents. Oretha has requested a loan to buy rice, pepper, oil and other items to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to have her own house and provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, oil and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dúo Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
Dúo Unidas Para triunfar.
La señora Nelli Jocabed de 23 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos vive en la aldea Santa Ana Antigua Guatemala, ella tiene una tienda de consumo diario la cual atiende todos los días, a temprana edad está trabajando para lograr compra un lugar propio donde vivir con sus hijos y también para darles estudio a sus hijos por esa razón está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles ya que necesita invertir más en su tienda para seguir creciendo y luchar por sus sueños
texts.en:
United to Succeed Duo.

Nelli Jocabed, 23, is married and has two children.  She lives in the village of Santa Ana Antigua, Guatemala.  She has a grocery store that’s open every day.  She’s been working since she was very young in order to get a place of her own to live in with her children and also to provide them with schooling.  This is why she’s requesting this loan in order to buy food items because she needs to invest more in her store to continue growing and striving for her dreams.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es: El Sr. Wilbert tiene 28 años,  se dedica a la venta de celulares de manera ambulante ofreciendo sus productos en oficinas y mercados,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Wilbert  va a utilizar  este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería celulares por mayor para surtir su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, El Sr. Wilbert enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una buena venta y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería para seguir mejorando su negocio y así de esta manera seguir generando más ingresos y por ende  mejorar su calidad de vida, el Sr. Wilbert se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Wilbert, 28, works selling mobile phones from place to place; he sells his wares in offices and markets.  This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  Wilbert will use this loan to buy mobile phone merchandise at wholesale to stock his business.  His reason for requesting this loan is to increase working capital.  Wilbert faces the business challenge of having good sales and will use profits earned to continue buying merchandise to continue improving his business so that he can continue generating more income and thus improving his quality of life.  Wilbert feels happy and grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones at wholesale.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Lanh has been running a general store in front of her house for twelve years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of basic products, such as sanitation items and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of basic goods, such as sanitation items and beverages,

loans.name: Deam's Group

texts.en:
Deam is 47 years old and is a resident in a rural area of Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She has six children, one of whom is still dependent on her and still in school.  

For her family, rice cultivation is a primary source of income, while pig-raising is a supplementary source of income. She has engaged in this business for several years. Her main challenge is the shortage of water supply, which decreases her crop output. 

Deam’s group consists of two female members—both are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Deam is seeking 100,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 600,000 KHR. 

As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to plant her rice on time and sell it at a high price so as to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland.

loans.name: Romuald

texts.fr: Romuald est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Romuald a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Romuald est marié à une marchande du nom de Christine. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Romuald vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Romuald mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la couture dans son atelier. Afin d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre plus performante pouvant lui permettre de mieux servir sa clientèle, Romuald désire acquérir un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Romuald s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Romuald sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Romuald is 40 years old and lives in Benin. Romuald attended school through high school. Romuald is married to a shopkeeper named Christine. The couple has five dependent children. Four of these children are their own, and some of them go to school. 

Romuald lives with his wife and children and he and his wife take care of the household expenses. In order to take care of the various family expenses, Romuald has been working as a tailor out of his studio for about a decade. In order to purchase a new and better sewing machine, which would allow him to better serve his clients, Romuald is asking for a loan from ALIDé. 

Romuald buys his supplies in his region. With the hope of satisfying his clients, and in order to grow his sales volume and income, Romuald is asking for his fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will certainly allow him to grow his business and increase his profits. His previous loans were reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende ropas interiores para mujer y tambien vende pijamas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene mas de 10 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas para sus hijas,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local mas grande donde pueda vender las ropas interiores.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pijamas y ropas interiores.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in her business selling clothes.  She sells women’s underwear and also sells pajamas.  She works from 8am until 5pm and has been in business for more than ten years.  In her free time she likes to bake cakes for her daughters.  Her dream is to expand the business and to have a larger locale in which to sell the underwear.  She requests the loan to buy pajamas and underwear.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy pajamas and underwear.

loans.name: Mario Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  El socio Mario Gustavo tiene 38 años,02 hijos,casado;el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos como llantas,baterías,timones entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, él socio cuenta con un local donde vende su mercadería por el centro de la ciudad ,el sueño del socio es poder tener un local propio para no pagar alquiler, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas para su negocio.


El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Mario Gustavo, 38, is a member of the “Pachamama” communal bank.  He’s married and has two children.  He alternates his daily chores with a business selling spare parts like tires, batteries, steering wheels, among others, for cars.  He’s been in business for some time and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He has a locale near downtown where he sells his wares.  His dream is to have a locale of his own to save on rental costs.  He’s a responsible, dedicated man who supports his family this way.  He’s requesting the loan to buy tires for his business.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his store.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: La socia es la señora Belén, ella tiene 52 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor en edad escolar íntegramente a cargo de ella, la socia se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, Belén realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y educar a su hijo. Belén en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pantalones, casacas y chompas para capitalizar su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad. La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Belén pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” del distrito de San Salvador de la  provincia de Calca en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Belén is a 52-year old single woman who is raising a son who is in school.  She sells clothing for men, women and children.  She has been doing this work for many years, and it has enabled her to raise her family's standard of living and provide for the education of her son.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets and pants for her business.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to maintain her business activities.  She promises to repay her loan punctually.  She belongs to the communal bank “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” in the district of San Salvador in the province of Calca in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as sweaters, jackets and pants.

loans.name: Germain

texts.es:
Germain, necesita otro crédito por la necesidad de invertir una nueva siembra de granos basicos, en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticidas,  pesticidas y preparar la tierra para la siembra.
El crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que obtuvo buena cosecha y tubo todo lo necesario para trabajar la tierra. Manifiesta que las condiciones de vida le ha cambiado, ya que económicamente esta mejor, teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Germain needs another loan to invest in the new basic grains planting season.  He will buy farm supplies like manure, insecticide, pesticide and prepare the soil for planting.  His previous loan was of much help to him because he obtained a good harvest and had everything needed to work the land.  He states that his life conditions have changed because by earning higher income he’s better off economically.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, pesticide and to prepare the soil.
